text: En fût au Café Cognac de Trois-Rivières. Robe ambrée foncée plutôt claire et surmontée dun léger col de mousse blanc qui sestompe rapidement. Arômes de cannelle, caramel, pain dépices, petits fruits séchés, raisins rouges, malt mielleux. En bouche, pain dépices et cannelle, malt caramélisé, toffee, clou de girofle, fruits séchés, raisin, figue. Quelques traces de saveurs grillées. Texture huileuse et légère pour le style et le haut taux dalcool, qui est bien caché par contre, corps moyen.

Bottled (backlog). Rubyish brown colour with a mediumsized beige head, that leaves some lace. Aroma is sweet malts, nuts, some spices, yeast and also a wee bit of ripe fruits and alcohol. Flavour is sweet malts, alcohol, some yeast, spices and dried fruits with mild nutty and some burnt sugary notes.
Bottled brown color with no head, sweet hibiscus honey nose and Flavors , sweet prune
Bottle into glass. Aroma of candied fruit. Pours a clear dark brownish red. Medium sweet taste. Medium bodied with a smooth finish. A very nice Belgian style ale.
Arômes de raisins et pruneaux, robe marron, faible mousse. En bouche, très original: on retrouve les pruneaux et le grain... Avec une touche dalcool. Assez bien équilibré.

0.75l bottle. Dark ruby body, lacing off-white head. Aroma of orange zest, coriander, raisins, toast and grapes. Taste of orange, dark sugar, grapes, plums and lemon zest. Its interesting that every sip is a bit different for me. Truly awesome and very special beer.

Cloudy brown purple colors with a copper hue and no visible activity. Frothy beige 1 finger head, lasting around 15 minutes, with strong legs.

Aromas of fruity vinous grapes and dark berries. Flavors of dark fruits, oak, grapes, apple, burnt sugar, molasses, herbal spices. Highly vinous but still pleasant having a soft sweetness coating and a nice sharp feel. Woody and slightly earthy.

Slick medium body with prickly carbonation almost champagne like. Well intensified medium strength finish, ending with a slightly spicy, fruity wine like dry but clean feel, and a lingering oaky woody feel.

Overall an excellent craft to savor like a good wine. Complex and rich tasty flavors. Vinous but still fresh. Warming but not too boozy. Well rounded thick body. More suited for cold winter times as an appetizer.

Vörösesbarna árnyalatban kerül elő az üvegből a kanadai főzde apátsági stílusú söre, mely testvérétől, a Lupulus-verziótól igencsak különbözik, számomra mégis szimpatikusabb, s a belga mondanivalót is autentikus módon hordozza, így a műfajra jellemző jegyek is sokkal jobban érvényesülnek. Mint például a különféle aszalt nyalánkságok, füge és rumos datolya, törökmogyoró, kékszőlő és dió vonalai, melyek egy élénk, alkoholos fátyol alatt teljesednek ki. Íze sem szab korlátokat az előbbi aromák testet öltésének, szerkezete befogadja a mazsolás-süteménytésztás, likőrös-aszalványos, de mindenekelőtt belga élesztős komponenseket, nem a legsúlyosabb azonban az ízvilág, a karakternek pedig egy árnyalatnyit kisebb szemű buborékokkal tarkított, krémesebb szénsavtartalom előnyére válna, bár ez utóbbi hiányérzet az idő előrehaladtával szinte megszűnik, csillapodik ugyanis az élénkség, jobban kisimul a test. Fűszeres, korianderes utóízzel, hosszan tartó, kerek jegyekkel búcsúzik az összességében igen tartalmas és élménydús ital.

750mL bottle, very generous extra from JulienHuxley. Cant quite make out the date, as its badly smudged, but its sometime in 2015, I believe. Drunk 6/9/16.Massive, overflowing, light beige head that is very well-retained, tops a ruby-tinged mahogany/beige body with good clarity.Brown sugar, brown bread, hazelnuts, vanilla, clove, black pepper, honey, the list goes on, as it should for a Belgian Strong ale, which showcases both specialty malt and yeast (as well as some spice here). It all works in a pretty harmonious balance, the more "dry" phenols and spices winning out, but never out-of-balance. Tons of fruitiness (red fruits) is highly enjoyable and bright and theres no sign of booze or any astringency. The esters are clean and the aroma is just all-around well-executed.Rich honey, brown bread and light cinnamon all combine with a strong sense of balance. Dries out considerably on the end with light fruitiness, some earthy, crunchy cereal-like notes and light hints of vanilla. Maybe just a bit more clove-like character than Id like, overall, but thats really the only complaint here. The carbonation and malty texture are both perfect as are the classy esters. Even the spice, which is moderately apparent, is a welcome complexity and blends in/matches with the phenols and malts. No alcohol either. Great balance.

Bottle shared @ Beerbecue by Joes. Hazy reddish to red-brown color, average sized off-white to beige head. Smell and taste malts, sweetish initially, quite herbal and spicy, sweet. Decent body and carbonation.

Bottle @ beerbecue. Brown colour with a medium sized off-white head. Smells mustard, mexicano, meat, all kinds of weird stuff. Tastes herbs, coriander, sweet. Puke aftertaste. Medium body, soft carbo.

Au visuel, la bière est dune grande beauté : une belle couleur bronze nous rappelant une vieille pièce dun sous, une mousse stable large dun doigt qui reste de longue minute et une belle effervescence laissant entrevoir un liquide bien en vie. Au nez on distingue très clairement les levures belges, les esters donnant un arôme très sucrée au liquide. En bouche, ça se gâte, alors que cest très raisin, sucré, avec une touche caramel. Lalcool présent réchauffe la gorge après déjà quelques gorgées. Malgré la complexité, le liquide reste assez mince, avec un petit manque de corps.

Pours an unfiltered mahogany with a massive tan head. Aroma is of plums, grapes, caramel, and toffee. Tastes of cherry, raisin, toffee, caramel, plums and sugar and spice. Has a medium body with average carbonation. Very smooth and fruity aftertaste that is really quite easy to drink despite the alcohol.

reddish brown colour, huge beige-ish head; aroma of driied fruits, chocolate notes, some banana, grape and, surprisingly, coke (or kola nut); taste of intensive dried fruitiness, banana and coke again as well as some chocolate, celery and herbs; great Belgian strong ale!

100 ml sample. Thanks, bunget! Clear red-brown. Aroma has malt sweetness spicy roots or vegetables (carrots?). Taste: malt sweetness, vegetable spice, warming alcohol. Ok, but bizarre. (backlog 17-JAN-2016)

Look: amber, hazy, no head.

Aroma: caramel, anise, cherry liqueur.
Taste: sweet with fruity sourness.
Flavour: jam, spicy herbs, caramel, yeast, black pepper.

Pleasant and drinkable, fruity and spicy balance.

Couleur brune sombre, légère mousse. Nez épicé avec canelle et levures. Gout malté caramel cuit, très épicé canelle, anis étoilé, girofle avec note de levures et orange sechée. Corps assez épais. Fin sur lépice.

Bottle 75cl, a clear amber beer with huge off white head. Nose is on yeast and spices. Aroma is on sweet caramel, lot of spice such as cinnamon and cloves, lot of yeast, less complex for the alcohol level, disappointing, too much spices in there. Clearly over rated.

Pours a dark brown/copper color with a foamy sticky head. Nose of brown sugar, dark red cherries, prunes, figs, red wine. Easy drinkable. Doesnt feel like a 10% beer. Medium body. Medium sweetness. Low bitterness. The nose is amazing but it lacks a litle on the taste imo but still an amazing beer.
750ml bottle. Clear burgundy with a foamy beige head. Flavors are yeast, dark fruits, spices, molasses, brown sugar, licorice and alcohol. Medium to full body, good carbonation, sticky texture.
Clear reddish amber colour with a tall tan head; aromas of spice, bread; balanced flavour with a neutral finish; tasty. Candy and sugar everywhere in the glass

750ml bottle. Clear dark copper body, medium beige head with average retention. Complex aroma of dried berries, bitter herbs, hops, spices, roasted nuts, earthy. Taste of rich caramel malt, yeast, raisins, cinnamon, peppercorns. Late warming effect. Exceptional.
Nice finish and smooth taste, hints of fruit make this a perfect sipping beer for an afternoon of leisure and cold.

Really extraordinary beer, plenty of nuances to nuts, brown sugar, spices, chocolate and raisins, among others. Like a puzzle perfectly done. Sweet but not cloying, strong but not heavy, complex but not difficult. Excellent.

Beauty and personality so exquisite sadly and rarely come together with such unexceptionable results. Charlevoix has cooked up a heavyweight champion of a beer, conjuring up what Christmas in Belgium must taste like in a liquid format. This rouge madame hardly seems 10% ABV from a taste perspective but her muscles are flexed when it comes to machinating any thoughts worth thinking. After but several sips, flavours of figs, cherries, red wine, vanilla, cinnamon, brown sugar and subtle leather are gladly all I can perceive. At 15CND per bottle, this is well worth every grueling moment spent doing unimaginative work from which to earn those fifteen clams.

Aroma is roasty malts, cinnamon, apple, pearl, yeast, plum and candy sugar. Taste is rich malts which are sweet and rich. A full palate of dark fruits come through nicely. Finishes nicely with some light spiciness and slight clove. Appearance is a dark clear amber with a medium pearl head that retains fairly well.

750ml bottle shared with family in law. Bottle was aged for a year. Aroma: red fruits, sugar, candies, floral, spices. App: dark brown, medium beige head, great retention. Murky a bit. Taste and palate: full body, medium sweetness, dry sweet finish. Maderized. Sticky. Overall: really sweet beer, glad I shared it. But still didnt have difficulty finishing my glass. Maybe aging it only changed the taste for the worst.

Bottle shared by Julien, medium sample. Dark brown color, medium head. Aroma of cookie, biscuit, spicy yeast, slight peppery, hint of roast, some red fruit. Soft sweet in taste, dry and spicy, bit chewy. Wonderfully balanced. Like one of the great Belgian examples, but with a dash of North American biscuit and cookie. Great beer.

75cl Bottle, tfs Julien! Dark brown colour, beige head. Aroma of figs, port wine, raisins, dark fruits, yeast, cookies, brown sugar. Flavour is quite sweet, dark malts, dark fruits, yeast, raisins, brown sugar, raisin, resembles St. Bernardus Abt imho. Good, but a bit fizzy.

2009 bottle with thanks to kbudd19! Pours hazy ruby hazel, small tan head, dissipates slowly, good lacing. Aroma is herbal and floral, quite spiced, allspice, clove, yeast esters, dark fruits. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter, some oxidation present, dark fruits, raisins, Belgian yeast esters, and quite a bit of spices. Medium-light body, high carbonation. A bit overspiced for my personal preference.
Clear reddish brown. Spicy nose, clove, coriander, reminds me of a tea sort of. Flavor is similar but the strong quad character comes through, alcohol. Not a huge fan but I can appreciate it.

Bottle, vintage 2009. Appearance is muddy brown with a thin layer of head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is gingerbread, faint hint of sour cherries, and ripe fruit. Taste is rich gingerbread, followed by a sweet malty backbone with hints of fig and caramel, a touch of light bitterness creeps up towards the backend, finshes exceptionally smooth with zero trace from the alcohol. Full bodied with a nice amount of carbonation. This has held up really well.
Wow. One of my all time favorites. Strong, yet very smooth. Love the spices. Surprising taste for the abv.

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 4 Oct 2014) Dark brown colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, spicy nose with notes of caramel, ginger, cinnamon, cardamom and dark bread. Malty, spicy taste with dried fruit, caramel, raisins, prunes, ginger, cinnamon and a gentle spicy bitterness. Full body, with a certain sweetness. Quite spicy, and with a certain alcohol bite. Still very well balanced and fairly warming. Very nice.
Clear reddish amber colour with a tall tan head; aromas of spice, bread; balanced flavour with a neutral finish; tasty. Candy and sugar everywhere.

Pours a very dark ruby with a large foamy tan head. Aromas of raisin, plum, sour cherry, dark berries, caramel, and a handful of spices I cant put a name on. Its full bodied with an average-high carbonation and a fairly oily mouthfeel. The taste is quite dry with a nice spicy bitterness. Not much booze taste, but the warming sensation is definitely there. My only beef with this brew is it had quite a present metallic flavor all the way through. Despite that, this was an enjoyable beer.

75cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 12-09-2014.
Pours very dark with frothy tan head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Ginger, spicy, roasty and caramel aromas.Medium body, average carbonation, some crispy texture. Taste follows the nose, spicy, ginger (anis), roasty, caramel. Some dry and moderate bitter finish .

750ml green bottle served around 15 degrees in a snifter:

This seasonal ale pours a dense foggy black coat covered by a finger or so of fine tanned head. Retention is moderate and lacing properties are excellent.

The complex nose delivers lots of spice with notes of cilantro, cinnamon, peppermint, paprika and another fresh herb I could not identify for sure. Very enjoyable.

On the tongue, this fine brew gives out dark fruits, subtle notes of honey, caramel and a touch of smoke from the paprika.

The mouthfeel is oily and very dense adding more enjoyable aspects to the tasting.

Overall, this is a robust and complex winter ale that had a great spice backbone. It is full-bodied and very satisfying. Ive got a 2012 in the cellar and Im pretty sure you can let this one age a good 5 years. Excellent product!
Couleur brune-rougeatres avec un col mince qui résiste. Aromes de fruits rouges,épices,caramel, ressemble un peu a une bière de noel. Bonne mais un peu surévalué selon moi.

Rating #1060 - April 18, 2014 - Have had lupulus and am super excited for this 750mL - 10%. Dark brown pour with a bubbly tan head, decent retention.heavy on carbonation Aroma is quite fruity. Full bodied. Creamy, buttery mouthfeel. Taste is plum, currant, raisin. Extremely smooth finish and a lingering taste of sweet malt. Astonishing.

Beautiful solid tan head, deep plum brown. Mostly sweet fruit in the aroma, raisin, something else. Not really getting much spice in aroma. Taste is quite good generally, but theres a metallic tinge to it thats not really good. Takes something away from the experience. The feel is perfect, full warm and boozy. Overall, its good but that metallic thing bugs me.

bottle aged 1 year. dark earthy red colour with lively head. Great aroma of dark fruit, berries, yeast, wood. Taste is well-balanced, sugary malts, but with a slight off-funk on the aftertaste. Nice beer.

750 ml bottle produced in July 2013. Pours a deep ruby/brown, cloudy, lots of off white head. Nose is sweet fruit esters, bread, dates, raisins. Taste is full of fruity esters, warming woody finish. Drinks on the lighter side of this style. Still a beast of a beer.

Pours clear amber-brown with two fingers of light beige head diminishing gradually to a thick cap, minimal lacing (4/5). Nose is... complex. Pureed peaches, sugary malt, dark fruit, spice (8/10). Taste is moderate to strong sweet malt, moderate bitter, distinct sour/metallic edge (7/10). Medium body, smooth, soft carbonation, with a lingering bitter finish and gentle alcohol warming (4/5).

Thats a big, complicated, not entirely approachable beer. The nose is utterly unlike anything else I can remember trying, and my wife disagrees, but once I came up with baby food peaches, thats where I stayed. Theres an edge on the flavour that is definitely unexpected and not entirely welcome - Im going with sour but it could less charitably be called metallic". Not entirely sure on this one - have several to cellar, and maybe thats the right approach. As it stands right now, and for the price, not a clear home run. (15/20)

Bottle: Thanks Pushkinwow: Served in a wine glass:
Thin beige lacing on top of a hazy darker ruby colored beer.
Nose of lots of balanced spices, cloves, speculaas spices, anise, some dusty prunes, light malt and some caramel tones, with a sprinkle of olives.
Flavours of malts, bitters, some spices, some cloves, erc etc... Balanced and well done!
Aftertaste bitter, spices, malty, light caramel/dark fruity touch.
Low carbo, light creamy close to silky mouthfeel, more than medium bodied and a creamy texture.
Delious stuff! Even with the spices, specially on the aroma, flavour is quite balanced. Well done!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottled at SBWF.  Hazy nut brown, mid sized head. Minty strawberry aroma. Sweet with near full body and rounded mouthfeel. Bubblegum, marzipan and strawberry esters. Mildly warming finish.

750ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, darkest brown colour, ruby red glimmer, average, thick, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Yeasty aroma, sweet-ish fruity notes of overripe apple, figs, dark berries, hints of orange, very cautious hints of ginger and cinnamon, a herbal touch. Taste is sweet malty, with milk chocolate touch, fruity, notes of dark berries, orange, orange peel, hints of cinnamon and ginger, a herbal touch; smooth, soft palate with gentle carbonation. Very well balanced, well-dosed spices, slightly too sweet.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a very dark brown with a large pillowy khaki head that lingers and leaves tight lace. The nose is lots of caramel malts with plenty of fruit; green apple, raisin, apricot, plum, dark berries and some green grape. There is also plenty of noticeable spice including cinnamon, cloves and a touch of ginger. Medium sweet start accented by some tartness in the middle and a light bitterness in the finish. Mouth is medium full and creamy with sharp carbonation. Really enjoyable.

Bottled. Thanks veliemboys. Pours a dark amber brown colour with a small head. Aroma is very sweet with figs, caramel and spiciness. Flavour is very sweet with overly ripe fruitiness, residual sugar, figs, strong cinnamon notes, nutmeg and green apples. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. Interesting flavours but this is just way, way too sweet to be enjoyable.

75 cl bottle. Bottled on 11.11.2013.
Pours clear dark red color with a large off-white head. Quite unique aroma with herbs, grassy notes, faint hops, some wood and dark berries. Sweet caramel and dark fruits on the flavor, sourish notes, some dark malts, lots of spice notes, dark berries and wood, faint yeasty notes too. Strong carbonation, a bit too sweet but the spices are nice.
4335

750ml bottle
Bottled 2013 11 11 - 
Pours dark brown with a smooth head. Aroma of ripe fruits, malts, earthy notes, spices and yeast. Taste is spicy, malty and earthy with some ripe fruitiness, syrup, yeast and toffee. Finish is sweet and syrupy with some ripe fruits, yeast and loads of spices. Too sweet and stuffy for my taste.

75 cl bottle @ home, bottled 11.11.2013
Aroma is unusual but nice with sweet fruity tones and licorice. Also ripe apricot tones, grass and herbal tones. Flavour is sweet with peppery spices, herbal tones, licorice and ripe fruits. Palate is a bit too foamy. Pleasant spicy Belgian strong, although perhaps a bit too sweet; finishing whole bottle would be a slow process.

I am not always the biggest fan of Belgian Ales, but this is an imperial that is as good as advertised in central Canada. A nice frothy head on dark red-brown hue body. The nose offers spices and Belgian yeast. The taste is a lovely balance of cinnamon-led spice, berries, crisp apples. soft caramel sweetness and in-balance Belgian yeast. Glad I finally tried this one!

650ml bottle from the lcbo
Huge frothy head maybe i should learn how to pour better
Lots of raisin and plum tasteand aroma very good

bouteille de 750ml de brune avec reflets rubis. arome de fruits cerise et de liqueur bourbon tres enivrante. au gout au dénote une présence de sucre tres importante. on trouve un petit gout de fruit et une petit acidité

Nice finish and smooth taste, hints of fruit make this a perfect sipping beer for an afternoon of leisure

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Viti, Vancouver; bottled 2013-07-10Beautiful mahogany color with red hue, creamy beige head. Deep aroma of caramel, with delicate fruity Belgian esters, ripe apple, and a late impression of chocolate; later a tiny whiff of ammonia yeast appears. The mouthfeel is still quite lean, and smooth, the sweetness is rather minimal; it has a good malt and caramel flavor, with some candi sugar, and those delicate Belgian fruity esters; the bitterness is really on the low side, maybe too much, hence the final is a bit too short. Spices? Not really.A true Belgian Strong, a good pleasure for winter days.There is some seriously good yeast job here.

0.75l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. A deep dark ruby red colored one, a little blurry perhaps and it has a nice medium sized lacing beige top. Super interesting aroma with lots and lots of different spices. I get cardamom, cumin, cinnamon and herbs. Almost like a Christmas beer? Also there is a strange sourness in the aroma. Apples is mentioned. I agree. Really gliding on the mouthfeel and it has a soft carbonation level. Tastes quite unique and interesting also. Lots of sweetness here! Much of the spices in the aroma is also found in the taste. The most interesting is perhaps cumin. Cant remember having that in a beer before. Can I? Is it added pumpkin also? Super easy drinkable and it has nuances of chocolate, wood juices and nuts. A really interesting and good tasting spiced up beer. 23.10.2013

750mL bottle courtesy of tom10101. 
Aroma is fairly spicy with anise, coriander, clove and light pepper. Medium malt character with dark, toasted bread, caramel and toffee. Medium fig, prune and raisin notes. 
Pours a dark brown with some hazelnut hues and a medium sized, fairly thick, tan head with slightly above average retention. Medium light lacing with medium legs. 
Flavor has a light sweetness with a moderately strong malt character. Lots of caramel and toffee, light toasted bread and faint chocolate notes. Medium fruit notes of cherry, raisin, fig and prune with some light plum notes. Much lighter spice notes with some clove, coriander and faint anise. Light alcohol spice. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and surprisingly low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a pretty enjoyable beer with a really nice malt character. The spice is a bit strong in the aroma but well balanced in the flavor. Nice ester quality. The most surprising thing to me about the beer is how well hidden the alcohol is.

Thanks to cfrancis for this one. Pours a clear dark brownish copper with a huge frothy brown head that lasts a while and leaves lots of lace. Aroma of plums, raisins, dark dried fruits, cherry fruity esthers, spicy Belgian yeast phenols, nutmeg, ginger and a light bit of alcohol. Taste is plums, raisins, cherries, brown sugar, toffee, nutmeg, ginger, alcohol, light cinnamon. Basically an assault on your taste buds of spicy Belgian yeast, Belgian phenols and spices, alcohol all while being in perfect balance with a high carbonation. Excellent Belgian dark strong.

Pours a fairly clear dark brown with a reddish tinge, a large beige head that slowly settles and leaves tons of lace. Aroma is spices, cinnamon, nutmeg, dark sugars, and dark dried fruits. Flavour is spice, cinnamon, nutmeg, mild bitterness, dark candied sugars/syrups, mild alcohol and dark dried fruits.

Beer Review

Dominus Vobiscum - Hibernus

I opened this and was immediately reminded of The Body Shop. The mix of spices and flowery scents did it.

Looms great. Nve clear reddish brown pour with a nice light tan head. Spicy flowery nose that is also a bit boozy. 

Odd taste. Very low on the beer qualities. Its like a shandy or something. The spices take over and you are not left with enough "beer"

I would suggest this for non-beer drinkers. Mulled wine, thats what it reminds me of more than a shandy.﻿
Color rubí oscuro con espuma beige. Aromas dulces de frutos rojos y melaza. Tiene densidad media baja, y sabor dulce y afrutado con toques de azúcar moreno. Muy rica.

February 7, 2014. 750mL bottle from Craigs collection. White head, dark brown colour. Touch of sour cherry in nose, and cherries and plums. Toffee and caramel flavours accompany cherry and plum flavours. Probably my favourite from this brewer.

A bottle from 2009 cellared well. The aroma is gorgeous with a burst of dark fruits; prunes, plum, tart cherries, raisin. Lots of toffee, brown sugar and molasses like malt notes as well. A nearly black body with a thick foamy beige head that covers the entire glass. Taking the first sip a slight sour fruit notes works well in the middle with lots of prunes and raisin notes. Light roasted malts with earthy flavours and toffee coming together. The finish is warm but not boozy with a good balance. A really smooth mouthfeel with a creaminess. Overall an incredible brew.

Pours a clear deep dark mahogany with a thing slightly off white cap that leaves behind spiderwebs on the glass. The aroma is sweet, dark fruits, light burnt sugars, old desk drawer, light grape, light marzipan, premium cigar (reminds me of alec bradley tempus). The flavour is also sweet, big on the dark fruits and burnt sugars, raisin, cigar (again AB tempus), some herbal presence. The finish is light but lingering, sort of herbal mixed with a rains sweetness. Solid, would buy this again for sure.
Candy in your mouth! Its like the cotton candy of beer. Nice Belgian style Quad! Picked it up at Bières Du Monde in Aylmer

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2015 Bière brune foncé aux reflets rubis, bien brouillée dune multitudes de particules en suspension, bonne effervescence, et surmontée dun col brunâtre pas tellement large et moyennement dense, mais bien persistant. Arômes principalement malté, pain grillé et beaucoup de caramel, avec également beaucoup de fruits foncés bien mûrs voire confit (raisin, cerise, prune/pruneau, datte) et un peu de noix de Grenoble. Aussi, on note également quelques effluves de malt fumée, de tourbe, de terre, de boisé et de feuilles mortes, ainsi que dagréables arômes liés à la fermentation, de plaisantes notes alcoolisées, de la banane bien mûre et des phénols épicés (poivre, clou de girofle, vanille). Enfin, dautres épices chaudes (piment de la Jamaïque, muscade) semblent être également présentes dans ce merveilleux nez dune profonde complexité et dune intensité très élevée. En bouche, pétillement modéré sur la langue, avec onctuosité élevée au palais, cest velouté et soyeux, mais aussi liquoreux et éthylique. Au goût, le pain grillé, le caramel et les fruits foncés dominent, avec des noix de Grenoble et un alcool significativement plus présent quau nez mais qui est très agréable et fort bien intégré. Aussi, légères saveurs de terre, boisé et feuille morte. On note également une bonne dose de banane bien mûre, voire flambée et caramélisée, mais les épices se font quant à eux plus subtils en bouche quau nez. Enfin, on décèle une pointe herbacée en fin de bouche, peut-être le houblon, ou une autre saveur liée aux phénols. Lamertume est minimale voire inexistante, la finale étant principalement alcoolisée avec notes de banane et de caramel. Bière chaleureuse et plutôt sucrée (mais pas trop, en tout cas pour moi, elle est parfaite!), excellente intégration des différentes saveurs, complexité et intensité très élevée en bouche. Excellente bière! /// On dit que cette bière a un excellent potentiel de vieillissement, et jai laissé vieillir une bouteille plus de 3 ans. Wow! Explosion des saveurs maltées, intégration parfaite des saveurs liées à la fermentation (banane, phénols épicés), douceur incroyable, alcool qui nest plus du tout perceptible, ni au goût, ni au palais, mais on perd la «pointe herbacée» (qui venait donc du houblon). Et absolument aucune trace doxydation! Cette dégustation est jouissive et je monte donc encore un peu les notes déjà excellentes de la bière. Zut!! Pourquoi nai-je laissé vieillir quune bouteille?

750mL bottle from LCBO. Powerful beer with a flavour and aftertaste that doesnt betray its alcohol. Nice but mild aroma. Pours really foamy, but settles into a nice amber head. Medium to full palate, perfectly carbonated for the style. Has a sweet, caramelly flavour - a little sweet for my personal taste, but a wonderful example of the style.
(bottle) clear reddish amber colour with a tall tan head; aromas of spice, bread; balanced flavour with a neutral finish; tasty

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 23.10.2013, 0,75l bottle sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Small creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet and spiced, caramel malts, spices, almond cake, sugar, toffee. Taste is sweet and kind of sour-ish, caramel malts, berries, butterscotch, toffee, flowers, grass, sugar. Medium bitterness. Fair enough, but very interesting though.

It pours ruby with brownish highlights; the head beige and foamy. The aroma has notes of: ruby fruit jam, sweet malts, raisins, and honey. The taste is medium sweet that finishes medium-light bitter; there are notes of: orange-zest, sweet malts, and slight anise. Palate is medium bodied, it has medium carbonation, and a medium finish. Overall, it the aroma has much more personality than the taste or the palate - it falls flat.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pours a deep red clear body with a medium creamy light beige head - very nice. Nose is spices, sweet caradamum, cumin, caramel, apple juice, hints of red fruits. Taste is sweet malts, red fruits, raisins, honey, hints of caramel and straw. Medium to full body, medium to high carbonation. Nice spicy ale.
Pours a dark brown with hints of amber. Aroma of cumin, nuts, spice and malts. Taste is also spiced with cardamom, cumin and cinnamon. Very special. Points for originality.

750 mL bottle. Pours dark mahogany with a thick tan cap of head. Solid aromas of dark fruit, rum, banana, medium treacle and oak. Sweet but well balanced by moderate carbonation, hop bitterness and alcohol bite. Dangerously smooth, full bodied and deep. Finishes with hops and spices. Delicious.

Pours blacker than sabbath with a one finger roasted marshmallow cap. Aroma is muted & clean. Tastes like deep fall & early winter: dark raisen, burnt sugar, exotic spices, wet pipe tobacco. Carbonation & alcohol count give this a clear twang that may turn some off but I dig the chunky taste of this brew. A great sipper as the turkey starts to sizzle in the oven on a cloudy thanksgiving in muskoka.

Bottle - decants a hazed deep brown with ruby highlights - 2 finger cap laces. Aroma is ripe with DMS (celery) turned me right off - flavour has promise but was ruined for me by the presence of cooked veggie tastes/aromas. I reserve judgement until I get a good sample.

Sweet rum raisin, belgian yeast, herbal hops, prunes but smells rather light and unique. Hazy brown, pours very foamy with a long lasting off-white head. Tastes quite interesting, upfront sweet candi sugar, rum raisin like on the nose, finishes rather clean with a slightly herbal finish. Very sweet but manages to be not at all cloying. Fairly light bodied too and above average carbonation. Good to try, wonder what the cellar what do to this one.
Excellente. Presque rouge, beau col. Goût un peu fruité (prune), sucré, odeur un peu florale, Peu damertume mais goût riche. Texture soyeuse.

750 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a murky orangey brown with moderate-sized light tan head. Aroma is banana, wheat, dark fruit and spice. Flavour is roasty banana, wheat malt, raisin, prune and modest spiciness. Alcohol is quite subtle. Nice one.

Brilliant product. Especially after having some of the lesser beers by these guys recently - this one takes it back to what they do best. Amazing. Pours ruby red with great head and lacing. Prune, raisin, some apricot, sweet malt and some florals. Finishes light sweet without being a sugar bomb. Soft carbonation, booze very well hidden. Great balance. Texture is silky smooth. Bottle from Delires du Terroir.

Bottle shared at Natifest 13. Poured clear dark brown color with an average to large frothy off-white head that was mostly lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate toasted malt, yeast, herbal earthy and alcohol aroma. Medium to abundant body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy complex bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. My expectations where surpassed with an above average for style brew.

750ml bottle, thanks to b3shine for sharing. Bottle says 2009 on it. Totally hazy dark brown / red color. Thin khaki head. Spray of lace. Whoa, that nose. Very unique. Big plum candy, dark fruit, rose, interesting unique medley of spices that I cant name. Incense? Some tobacco, some kind of herb that one might be inclined to burn for aromatics. Something floral, or medicinal about it? Really weird, herbal, spicy dark fruity aroma, so bizarre. Some caramel malt. Spicy taste, moderate bitter, minimal sweet. Just a light hint of alcohol warmth, its reasonably well hidden under the intense aroma. Smooth, kind of crisp lighter carbonation, more dry finish, and a big body. Definitely a big, flavorful beer, very unique flavor... But the flavor direction is one that I cant really love personally, despite how odd and unusual it is.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared by me with the group; thanks DuffMan). Looks good; a cloudy amberish brown with light beige head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells solid; Belgian yeast and dark fruit that opens up to some balanced spice notes as it warms. Tastes like it smells with a nice, smooth mouthfeel. A good example of the style.
Pours a deep ruby with a light tan head and nice lace. Aroma of blackberries & Ribena. Surprisingly mild flavour, fruity and sweet. Low carbonation and moderately creamy body. Nice!

copper brown with some creamy white head. Nose f plum, cherry, candy sugar, tropical fruit, rum, fruit cake. Flavor is malty, candy sugar, cherry, a little grape jelly, tropical fruit, kiwi, light spice, dried apples, raisins. Full, sweet finish.

Bottle.  Pours deep brown with brown head.  Big spicy boozy aroma with some molasses.  Taste is full of brown and burnt sugar, lovely spices (coriander and cloves).  Full body, perfect carbonation.  Terrific stuff!

I cracked a 2009 version the other day. On the one hand the beer aged nicely in that the body became very rounded, malty, balanced and not very sweet. One the other hand, sarsaparilla notes totally dominated the beer. I dont know if sarsaparilla root was put into the beer, but it tasted like unsweeted and fairly pleasant Rootbeer. Since I like Rootbeer, I rather enjoyed this beer, but totally over spiced. Perhaps drinking it fresher would be more beneficial, but given the style aging seems appropriate. With a more balanced spice profile this could be fantastic. As is, it is just OK.

750 ml, Peluso, 10%. 
Wow! Quelle bonne bière! Ambrée très foncée avec 2 doigts de mousse. Odeur  cassonade et épices. Sirupeuse, malt très présent dans le goût, et le soupçon d'épices très bien dosé fait la différence. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hoo, boy what a nice beer! Pours dark amber, almost orange-pekoe like. Initial foamy tan head dissipates to a nice covering and healthy ring. Some lacing (spotty). Nose sweet and spicy. Aromas show prunes, candy, almost maple syrup, dark grapes, raisins, cereal and a bit of grassy hop bite just to keep everything honest. Taste is pretty heavy sweet through most of the tasting, and a light bitterness to the finish. There is also a very tiny salty hint in there. The body is medium with a somewhat oily texture and average carbonation. This is a top notch beer, no doubt about it.

Un vrai délice hivernal, la DV Hibernus figure parmi les bières de luxe québécoises : une épaisse liqueur brune sous une mousse couleur cassonade, au nez elle présente des notes sucrées, boisées, florales et caramélisées rappelant la DV Double. En bouche, elle explose avec ses saveurs vinées, son fort sucre résiduel, ses grains maltés et un petit côté "bonbon". Une merveilleuse représentante de Charlevoix.

Des arômes de prunes et dépices. Des saveurs de caramel, de prune, cassonade. Cette bière est brassée avec des épices. On y retrouve des notes subtiles de muscade et de coriandre. Une belle réussite.

Une bière de Noël non-avouée ou une brune forte de style belge foutrement bien épicée; dites-en ce que vous voulez, mais buvez-en tous! De lanis en entrée avec une valse cannelle-girofle-caramel-raisins.... Il faut définitivement la laisser ce réchauffer pour lapprécier pleinement. La Dominus Vobiscum Hibernus est un désormais parmi mes classiques.

750ml bottle pours a translucent copper brown with some creamy white head.  Nose f plum, cherry, candy sugar, tropical fruit, rum, fruit cake.  Flavor is malty, candy sugar, cherry, a little grape jelly, tropical fruit, kiwi, light spice, dried apples, raisins.  Full, sweet finish.
Belle couleur dorée. Peu pétillant. Goût faible de conifère avec un peu damertume en fin de bouche. Prends du caractère lorsquelle est chambrée.
Bouteille de 750ml, robe rousse orangée, arôme florale de carmel et de levure, goût dépices, excellente bière!

It took me 4 bottles through 1 1/2 year to evaluate this one. Two bottles were tremendous and two were very deceiving. So, Ill do sort of an average between the four of them.
Aroma: A lot of spices; cinnamon, clove, mixed with caramel, sugar cane and candied fruits. Most of the bottles tested had a pretty complex and defined nose except for the last one that was bought a week ago which had aroma disappearing fast and leaving unpleasant meat and earthy notes.
Appearance: One of the bottles tested last spring had no head at all. The other ones had an average creamy, moderately lasting head with also average lacing.Color is dark brown with red glints.
Taste is very caramel, toffee, crème brulée  and maple with spices like pepper, nutmeg and clove. In all cases it would benefit the overall taste that the spices stick out more. Sugar notes are very dominant. In most cases body is medium, texture is oily and carbonation lively except for that bottle bought last spring that was absolutely flat. I was told at the time that there had been a bottling problem with that batch. Not recalling the batch was, to my opinion, a poor corporate decision. The conclusion of all this is thats a very unstable beer. If youre lucky, youll buy a very good bottle. If not; well, tough luck. For myself, I had 2 good ones and 2 bad ones.
Bottle shared with northropfrye. Northropfrye woke me up to try this beer - its that good. Sweet and malty. Very flavourful. Now Ill go back to sleep.

Thanks, Tommy. Aroma of fruit punch, bubblegum, bread, maybe a touch metallic. Dark black, maybe slightly red body with foamy brown head. Marvelous sweet fruit malty taste, a touch of tartness, bread. A solid Belgian strong ale.

Pours a deep brown with a ruby tint. Ample thick tan head. Aroma is dark fruit, apple cider with a little spice and yeast. Taste is wonderfully balanced with all the previously stated notes along with a more peppery and spicy palate. Alcohol is very well worked and only slightly warming. Finish has a lingering dark fruit note with a very dry white wine accent there as well. Wonderful.

bouteille 750ml acheter a la barik. De couleur brun acajou avec une mousse beige et tenace. Des aromes dépices et de fruit confits. En bouche des gouts de cassonade, muscade et de clou de girofle et une légère présence dacool. Tres bonne bière! A consommé de préférence les soirée froide !

750mL Bottle, purchased at Depanneur Rahman - Montreal, QC. Effervescent, foamy, and sheeting with a glassy and crystalline aroma bespeckled with gobs of Special B-like caramel-raisin malt notes and plum pudding spice. Christmas, warm and figgy-pudding. This paired beautifully with chocolate cake. The body warms graciously, spinning off strands of complex malt darkened with flame and lightened with exotic spices, harkening cinnamon, coriander, and cardamon. After having the somewhat underwhelming Double from Charlevoix, this was most appreciate twist of qualities, paralleling the quality of similar dark spiced strong beers straight from the country of origin.

From a 750mL bottle from Omni. Pours a deep amber/black with a good amount of head that leaves a bit of lacing. Smell is candied cherries, cinnamon, and things Id usually associate with a funky beer. Palate is a bit strange with nearly no carbonation but a sticky mouthfeel with medium body and good warming in the aftertaste. Taste is very interesting, nothing like its smell, sweet at first, then the spices kick in and then it all gives way to a smooth and very long lasting sweet aftertaste. Very interesting beer.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, thanks Aaron! Dark reddish brown with off white head, aroma has notes of honey, caramel, slight banana, hints of chocolate, hints of roast, lots of dark fruit with raisin, figs and plums as well, touch of dark molasses.  Taste is a mix of dark fruits, white fruits and some green raisin, touch of chocolate and banana, hints of spice and ginger notes in there with a touch of earth, finishing fairly sweet, slight spicy.

Bottle at Home shared with friends, courtesy of Aaron. Thanks Man! Poured a deep crimson with a beautiful tan head and great lacing. Spice, gingerbread, dark fruits, licorice, and tobacco in the aroma. Coffee, spicy yeast, black licorice, anise, nutmeg, and dark fruits with a lightly bitter finish. Medium body with medium to light carbonation.

Bottle @ Stephens house. Dark reddish maroon appearance with a brown head. Quite spicy, brown sugar, caramel malty, raisin, dark berry, leather aroma. Caramel, toasty, a touch burnt toffee, slightly smoky, spicy yeasty flavor. Fun beer to share- not sure Id want a bottle to myself.

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur brune foncée, mousse dense couleur moka laissant une légère dentelle. Arômes dépices, de vanille et de fruits confits. Goût dépices, de sucre brun et de fruits confits, lalcool est très bien camouflé. Texture moyennement riche et carbonation moyenne-faible.

Liquide brun aux reflets rougeâtres, coiffé dune mousse franche et persistante, marquant les parois du verre dune dentelle dignes des montagnes de Charlevoix. Des arômes de cannelle, de clou de girofle et de menthe poivrée imprègnent efficacement les narines au passage. Lanis étoilée traine la patte, mais elle est tout aussi présente que ses consurs. Un goût tout aussi prononcé dépices variées, distingué et équilibré dans son dosage, se frayant son chemin au travers le gosier, en nous laissant percevoir lalcool qui suit son chemin, sans vouloir se faire remarquer. (277-260612)

Sample on tap at Saint-Pub (Baie-Saint-Paul). Pours dark red with medium beige head. Nice lacing. Aroma and flavour: malt, spices, alcohol, cinamon, gingerbread, caramel, fruits. Very awesome! Taste is a bit too sweet unfortunately. Full bodied beer. Alcohol well balanced. Great beer, would consider it outstanding if it was a little bit less heavy (not ideal for hot summer afternoon).

750 bottle. Pours dark brown with a nice tan head. Nose is slightly acidic with some hints of chocolate. Flavors of spiciness (cinammon?) with slight burnt malt and cocoa notes.   Flavor drops off a bit at the end. Nice smooth fluffy body. Alcohol well hidden for 10%. Good beer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Bottle 2009 gushes very slowly. Pours unclear ruby amber with a big creamy beige head. The aroma is a little like a light barleywine, a bit of winey malt fumes. The flavors brings some sweet perfumey malts with some berry earthy aromas settling on the tongue. The body is medium to thick, right on the money for a Belgian Strong Ale making it pretty smooth. It may have fallen off just a tad.

Pours a clearish amber with a nice pillowy beige head.  Aromas of sweet banana, clove, spice.  Very nice aroma.  Taste is also very good - smooth yeast, banana esters, some clove.  Just a touch of sweetness before the quick dry finish.  Alcohol is completely hidden.  As this warms, Im getting more and more of the spicyness.  Very similar to Fantome de Noel.  Very nice.

Dark burgundy brown with a great brown head. Big spicy nose of cloves, cinnamon, and a nice herbaceous, minty - thyme notes. almost full body, Christmas cake spices, clovey, some dark fruits in there too like black cherries. Long warm finish. A winter treat. On tap at Cheval Blanc for their 25th anniversary.

750 ml bottle. Pours a very dark amber, foggy red with a persistent beige-orange head. Smells quite spicy. Tastes quite spicy also, with notes of cinnamon, ginger, coriander, cloves and also the notable presence of burnt caramel. Light bitterness in the finish, along with the warm feeling of alcohol. Body is average, palate is frothy. A top notch, spicy winter warmer. Kind of hard on the wallet, but SO good on the palate.

Bouteille 750 mL. Brune foncee avec peu de mousse. Nez de pain dépices, de banane et dalcool de cerises. Bouche sur les épices et la banane, avec le malt en finale. Un peu trop sucree a mon gout et manque de CO2.

750ml, best before end 2012 - a lofty dark tan head over a semi-clear dark red-brown body. Aroma is mildly fruity and sweet, hints of yeast now well aged. Tastes of sweet fruits and spice, sasparilla, a hint of earthy mineral, some fading lemon peel. Ends with a dry palate that sets off the sweetness. Good beer in a category that is often hard-to-please.

Bottle 750 ml [2012]. Apperance: Pour dark brown with amber reflects. Medium brown head with good lacing. Aroma: Loads of spices, gingerbread, yeast, banana, brown sugar. Taste: Spices, gingerbread, malt, sugar. Warming alcohol, underlying sourness and dry spicy finish. Overall: A very good beer from Microbrasserie Charlevoix. Taste like no other beer.
I did not expect this from A Strong Brown beer. Especially from a Belgian recipe. It is Spicy and sweet and reminds me of a good porto. Very good tasting but not for every occasions.
brown/ black tea like colour.belgian yeast note, sweet and fruity aroma. rich flavour, sweet but not sickly. has a hot finish. flavour brew!

750ml bottle. Pours a deep amber with lots of orange highlights when held directly to a light source. The head is big and nicely tanned; takes 3.72 hours to recede and leaves a hint of lace. Theres loads of spice on the nose (Im thinking ginger & cinnamon) and a TON of orange peel. I keep being reminded of Christmas. The booze doesnt really show at all unless you take a huge inhale. Has the same things going on on the palate. Not as sweet as I expected. Theres a bit of a brandy note there too. Not nearly as interesting on the palate as it was on the nose.

Bottle - 750ml. Pours a cloudy dark brown body with a thin beige foamy head. Enjoyable malty/hoppy aroma with vineous, fruity, brown sugar, and yeasty hints. Taste is very well balanced. It carries plummy, yeasty, and some subtle oaky notes. Alcohol is well hidden. Ends with a decent, warming bittersweet finish. Another good reason to love winter.
Bottle, pours a hazy brown, aroma is very spicy, a good solid body, lots of life, lots of flavour, really yummy stuff.

750 ml bottle.  Dark, reddish brown in colour.  Lots of head, persistent too.  Smell of dark fruit... this is going to be good!  Palate is smooth, round nice lonv finish.  The taste is way too fruity for me.  Lots of cherry, cough syrup, almost like a Duchesse de Bourgogne.  Not my style.

Bottle 750ml. 2009.

Pours brown, with beige head, good rentention. Aroma is mildy alchoolic, some malts, and unleashed caramel. Taste is massively caramel. Tofee, spices. Good carbonation, full bodied. Awesome balance. Low feelinf of the alchool. A very good beer.

750mL 2009 ed thanks to a generous trader on BA. Pours a clear doppelbock amber. Very malty auburn color, good clarity. Carbonation is huge generating a massive, yellowish, almost orangish head. Excellent retention and big soapy swathes of lace. Nose is pina colada, some fresh pineapple, big esters, flowers, mild metallic character, some licorice, fruit cake. Taste is similar to Gouden Carolus: mild chocolate, licorice, dark fruits, but not nearly as sweet or alcoholic feeling. Not too minerally. Decently heavy mouthfeel but not overwhelming. Palate is effervescent, clovey, sugary. Plays a difficult roll in being sweet and dark fruit heavy without being cloying or syrupy. Believe it or not, but this is a little bit reminiscent of Westvleteren 8.

Bottle pours a reddish brown color with a 3 finger beige head that leaves some really nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is dark fruits and hints of yeast and spices.  Taste is mild dark fruits with some yeast and spices with a malty sweetness and a mild hoppy bitter finish.  This is a pretty fine ale for the style and was greatly appreciated.

750 mL bottle.  (2009 - bb dec 31, 2012).  Pours like a true Belgian: Dark brown with ruby highlights and a big, fluffy, beige head.  The aroma is big and fruity, with dried fruit as well as ripe berries.  The flavour is sweet and surprisingly spicy.  Not that its really spicy; I just didnt get that hint from the aroma.  There is a little dried fruit here as well, but the berries are gone.  Nice finish.  Solid body.

2009 version.  Pours a very dark, viscous brown with a big frothy off white head with small retention.   Aroma is a buffet.  Caramel, soft spice, candy, malt and a little bread.  Taste is again party time for your mouth.  Sickly sweet, caramel and candied.  Big mouthfeel with soft spices that warm the mouth.  Great beer.

Bottle. Pours a deep amber hue with a lively golden head that leaves thick lace. Aroma of sweet toasty caramel and spices. Flavour is toasty caramel, honey, soft spices, light burnt sugar, subtle floral fruit. Incredibly tasty stuff!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle from 2010 - found at Kensington in Calgary - totally random find but excited to try it again. Dark brown with a nice tan/brown head. Sweet malt, bread and yeast tang with a bit of lactose and tartness, plums, spices, alcohol but without a bite (at least on the nose). Sweet with a hint of prickly alcoholness, full bodied and surprisingly carbonated, lots of spice and quite dry on the finish along with a nice malt backbone. Very interesting beer - would have liked to be able to compare this fresh to this bottle but either way a tasty beer that I was glad to try.

Pour very dark brown with purplish edges beige head. Aroma sweet, candy sugar, spices, plums, dark fruit, chocolate. Taste honey, dark fruit, malt, caramel, candy sugar, spices, fig, yeasty esthers, floral hops. MF medium body with fizzy carb. Good stuff well balanced and unique flavors, not overly sweet well balanced and relatively easy drinking.

Appearance: black with a huge brown head. Aroma: raisin, chocolate, malt & grass. Flavour: raisin, chocolate,malt,
 Vanilla, with a long dry finish.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample @ RBSG 10.  Pours a clear brown color with a medium sized beige head.  The aroma was full of sweeter malts, caramel, plums, herbal notes and spices.  The flavor was very complex with caramel malts, spices, ginger, herbal notes, yeast and dark ripe fruits all competing for palate time.  Some alcohol, but it is mainly warming.  Very good stuff.

Bouteille 750 ml. 10%. Cuvée 2011. Couleur brune presque noire, mousse beige abondante. Arôme dépices, chocolat, un peu dagrume, fruits mûrs. En bouche, porto, épices, alcool, prunes, sucre dorge. Finale en alcool avec un pedhoublon. Très bonne.

Pours a deep ruby red, somewhat brown with a thick creamy tan head. Aroma is quite subtle with herb and spice notes and a little dark fruit sweetness. Taste is quite rich and sweet throughout and not really bitter at all. Full bodied, smooth and creamy on the palate, and soft carbonation. A very nice beer overall.

Hazy brown color with a huge frothy tan foam. Big sweet spicy ginger, mint leaf, grape, pit fruit, holiday spice aromas. Light to medium bodied with average co2. Light to medium sweet spicy flavors of  brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger cookie, spearmint, pit fruits, brown malts--very good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
(750ml bottle) Courtesy of MartinT. Full aroma of leaf, lime zest and vanilla. Very smoothly malted with almost a flat ginger ale base. Very interesting and good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared by CapFlu.  Very deep amber, thick cream colored head.  Aroma is yeasty, caramel, prunes, light alcohol, dried fruit.  Taste is raisin, yeast, light alcohol caramel, light roastiness- pretty complex.  Very sold Belgian Strong.

2009 edition. Did not seem under pressure, but after taking the cap off, the brew came overflowing. Pours a huge head in the tulip glass with a little dark ruby red colour underneath. Clean and very carbonated. The cap was beige, with tiny bubbles that made it foamy but with extreme retention. At first pour, the nose was rather sour. After breathing a bit, the spices came out. Mostly liquorice (anise) was on top, with hints of mint, nutmeg and cloves. Oily mouthfeel with a little stickiness to it. The taste resembled to the smell. No burning at all, quite smooth, with the liquorice, spices and brown sugars. A pretty interesting Belgian strong ale.

2009 bottling. A bit of gush on the decapping. Deep red with a large bubbly brown crown that hangs around and has some slippery lacing. The aroma is very very good. Plums and toffee form the main body of the aroma, licorice and light nutmeg and clove, faint pepper, white chocolate, bit of brown sugar and some type of cherry something - overall this is soft, smooth and soothing and I love it. Wonderful taste as well - Light spices and caramel together with the nutmeg / clove mix, plum, brown sugar, perfect sweetness, mild molasses and probably something else, licorice. Very good complexity without the need to search and concentrate. Perfect carbonation, hints of alcohol here and there, long lasting coating and a lengthy light spicy finish. A swirl at any point adds some life to my glass. Im not sure why I waited so long to drink this but some extra time sitting in the Beerium has payed off.

Bottle.... Poured dark ruby-redish with a thin off-white.  Lots of plum notes, dark fruits like raisins and cherries.  A little bit of yeast tanginess with bittersweet brown sugars tones, malts, and oak.  Finished a little drier than the full body of the brew would lend itself to.

[bottle]
Sweet aroma with floral and spicy hops. Hazy brown-red with a lasting, thin, tan cover. Sweet brown sugar flavour with ginger and spices. Light body, sugary sweet finish, moderate carbonation.

on tap at lautre oeil. dark brown, slight haze, tall beige head, excellent retention and lacing. aroma is bread, pineapple (!), molasses, bananas, spices, earthy yeastiness. taste is raisins, roasted malts, dark fruits, yeast goodness, molasses, touch of acidity and warming alcohol, some sweetness but ends up with a dry mouthfeel with a superb hoppy profile - resinous and grassy (medium to fully hopped). lively but relatively soft carbonation. smooth. full bodied. MdC has done it again !

Pours a deep brown with a tan, tall, creamy head with a modest to high amount of carbonation to keep the head full for a long time. A spicy nose greets the senses and has an heir of a pumpkin brew  as nutmeg and allspice can be noted. A Belgian yeasty estery nose also sneaks int later in the nose adding some additional spiciness imparted from the yeast. Flavor star with a yeasty Belgian kick but quickly moves to a nutmeg, allspice and estery presence and finishes with a bready ending and slight brown sugar kick. I got an odd flavor that I can only describe as grilled mild Italian sausage taste in the middle. Body is heavy with a slight sharpness from the carbonation. Overall an interesting combination. The spices are a bit strong and tend to make it a little cluttered but still a good brew.

A: Pours a dark amber color with a tall khaki head to go with it.

S: First thing I pick up is some tart cherry.  Theres a nice fruit character overall with some raisins and plums in there.  A big yeastiness and a really green aroma.  I seem to get some grass, rosemary, and anise.

T: A big red grape and fruit flavor provides a nice sweetness.  There are some good dark sugar and malt flavors, too.  Fairly herbaceous, but in a good way--not medicinal.  A really nice spiciness that I didnt get on the nose.  Lots of all-spice with a little bit of nutmeg and anise.

M: Medium in body with a fairly high level of carbonation.

O: Really complex beer with plenty of great flavors.

750ml bottle provided by Alex for our rare Canadian tasting...Pours a light but clear brown, looks a little watery with a decent light tan head...An incredibly spicy aroma that instantly has me thinking Christmas beer. All spice from start to finish, tons of nutmeg, pine tree needles, and alcohol...The taste is more of the same, all spice and needles, I feel as if I walked up to someones front door and took a bite of their front door wreath. Not a pleasant taste or sensation. 

This is a Christmas spice beer that should be avoided unless you LOVE this style of beer

dark nut amber, thin beige head. Floral nose of raisin, pepper, and light pumpernickel bread. Flavor of pepper, lemon, tea, lots of grapefruit, very bright but peppery. Enjoyable stuff, low carbonation allows many elements to exist.

Bottle shared by CaptainCougar.  Pours clear tawny with an average, frothy beige head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (bread, cookie, caramel, toasted, nutty), light hops (earthy), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of nutmeg and horse blanket.  Flavor is heavy malt (bread, cookie, caramel, toasted, nutty), light hops (earthy, herbal), and average esters (apple/pear) with notes of alcohol, dates, brown sugar, and nutmeg.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation, low creaminess with a dry finish.

Bottle thanks to Glouglouburp: Pours a clear deep copper amber with a spotty-lacing froth of light tan head.  Has a floral orange peel nose with a light caramel and biscuity sweetness.  Starts with a soft effervescence and light toffee sweetness with some floral hop notes and lavender spice before a drier biscuity finish.  An pretty well-balanced and enjoyable brew.

Pours a dark ruby color. Large off-white head. The aroma has a tun of spice. Plum, coriander, bread, clove and a hint of. The flavor is quite spicy and very fruity. Plum, coriander, bread, raisin, cinnamon, brown sugar, and clove. Not bad, just a little sweet for my taste.

Bottle, thanks to hobbersr. Pours clear ruby, very thick and very persistent off-white head. Stunning lacing. Nose is very spicy, red berries, fresh and light, yet showing some darker notes; earthy. Flavours of red licorice, spice (Ginger?) and very long finish. Excellent brew.

Une belle mousse abondante et solide chapeaute un liquide à la robe brune foncée.  Au nez, des parfums de mélasse et de réglisse se dessinent avec allégresse sous des effluves dépices, de fruits en confiture et de sucre candi.  Au goût, le liquide transporte des épices fortes qui, une fois réunies avec les cerises, les dates et les figues, supportent parfaitement les saveurs douces et sucrées de réglisse noire en jujubes.  En bouche, le liquide, à la fois crémeux et huileux, a une tenue exemplaire avec une effervescence fine qui allège toute sa splendeur et sa richesse.  La finale maltée et épicée se fait en souplesse et en pur bonheur lorsquun alcool jusquici bien dissimulé illumine doucement la langue.

750ml green bottle acquired from Goldorak in 07 Beer Advocate CANBIF. 2007 edition. Dark brown with reddish hues, stable small, tightly beaded off white head. No lacing. Aroma is of caramel malts, spice, yeast, cherry. Flavour has cherry fruit notes, caramel, some yeast. Some initial sweetness but dries out  considerably in the finish. Medium bodied, maintains a tightly beaded carbonation. Alcohol is integrated well, great drinkability, holding out quite well in 11. Will have to try a fresh unaged bottle and see if it holds up to this 07.

750ml bottle from Le Gobelet. Édition 2009. aged 1 year at cellar temperature. pours a beautiful dark caramel brown with the lovliest thick, creamy tanned head that leaves incredible lacing on the goblet. aroma is dominated by dark fruits, but has hints of chocolate and vanilla in there as well. in the mouth there is a lot of spices going on, and then some sweet caramel in the finish. a lingering flavour of intense spices prevails. mouthfeel is full bodied, with lots of carbonation. the alcohol is definately there, but doesnt disturb this beers drinkability. cant wait to try the Lupulus! i paired this one with a 5 year aged wine smoked cheddar and a Cendrillon goat cheese. a match made in heaven. nothing beats a good Quebec craft beer and Quebec artisanal cheese pairing!
Bottle @ Pauls saison tasting. Brown pour with tan head. Aromas are sweet candied sugar, fruity and spices tones. Flavor is very spicy, thorough herbal tones.

Bottle courtesy of Dany, thanks burp. Pours a dark bruin body with an off white head and decent head retention.  Hibiscus, rose peddle, vine y hop tones.  Light roast y malt hints and light citrus undertones.  Light candied sugar sweetness with a mild spicy warming.  Nice.

Bottle, shared with family. Pours a deep amber hue with a lively golden head that leaves thick lace. Aroma of sweet toasty caramel and spices. Flavour is toasty caramel, honey, soft spices, light burnt sugar, subtle floral fruit. Incredibly tasty stuff!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: UPDATED: JUL 15, 2011 Édition 2009 vieillie un an, dune couleur rubis pâle et une mousse généreuse, on décèle immédiatement les arômes dépices, de fruits sauvage, le pain dépice et le caramel.  Très généreuse en bouche avec une succession de saveurs allant du caramel épicé aux fruits confits ... des touches de coriandre et de miel de fleurs sauvage... difficile à cerner exactement!  Sucre abondant et devenant de plus en plus présent au fur et à mesure que la bière se tempère, mais nenlevant toutefois rien à la rondeur quasi-parfaite (selon mes goûts) de cette petite merveille.

750mL bottle, pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of apricot, other dark fruits, yeast, caramel malts and molasses. Flavour of molasses, sweet caramel malts and dark dried fruits - lingering sweetness of fruits and molasses.
Cuvée 2009, (vieilli un an) biere tres tres bien qualibré... le malt dun gout legerement caramélisé... un bon houblon belge et de bonnes notes dépices. Tres bonne biere dhiver!

Sweet dark fruit with plenty of nutmeg and floral soapy character in the nose.  Opaque dark brown body is topped by a generous and lasting off white head that lasts forever and coats the sides of the glass.  Big sweet and full flavour is quite sweet and soapy with lots of nutmeg.  Medium full body with smooth texture and soft bubbled effervescence.  Chalice.  Cellar temperature.  Bottle sampled at presarios Als vs. Stamps tasting.
bottle shared at RBSG10 Grand tasting - cherry tartness and a touch of caramel malts. some funk  and piney hops and a light touch of chocolate candy.

caramel, nuts, roasty, brown, clear, frothy, lightly sour, alcohol, clove, ginger, woody, 

keyboarddoentwork

Color is dark brown-ish / red with a large beige creamy head. Aroma is Spices (Cinnamon, cloves), kind of similar to brett, fruits, sugar. Medium Body and low carbonation. Flavor is more smooth, berries, cinnamon, no aftertaste. Well balanced, pretty well done.

Rating 1700!
Bottle thanks ti fred82! Thank you!
Dark brown pour, huge fluffy white head.
Aroma: spices! Lots of them! Nutmeg, cinnamon, cardamon, cloves, and some wonderful brown sugar/bready bread puding malts. 
Flavor: quite sweet, lots of bread, brown sugar and a boat load of complex spices. 
Very complex and outstanding beer!

Bottle shared at DickinsonBeers place. Pours brown with a beige head. Nice spicy aroma with some bready/doughy malts. The flavor has a good balance between sweetness and spices, with some fruity notes and a dry finish. Tasty.

Bottle 750ml.Clear medium to dark amber color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige to orange head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, moderate to heavy spicy, ginger, pepper, cinnamon, cardamom. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long to average duration, moderate to heavy spicy, ginger, cinnamon, cardamom. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Way to spicy IMO. [20100821]

[Bottle, sample courtesy of Rastacouere at RBSG 10, thanks!] Pours cola brown with a small khaki head. Huge spicy aroma with nutmeg, lemon and caramel. Taste is fairly sweet, and has a lot of similarities to a good mulled cider. Good mouthfeel, smooth, and has a long finish. A very nice Christmas/cold season beer. Thanks again, Rastacouere!

Bottle at Papsø.
Clear orange red coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel, dried fruits and burnt sugar with notes of spices.
Sweet and spicy flavour of caramel and dried fruits with notes of burnt sugar.
Sweet finish.

Bottled. A hazy deep red beer with a huge bubbly tan head. The aroma has notes of malt, spices, caramel, and cola. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, spices, and some nuts, leading to a dry spicy finish. Thanks madsberg for sharing.

clear brown,  large light brown head
nice sourish and very spicy aroma. 
flavor is spicy, faint roasted stuff, wood, booze , licorice, complex. caramel

Huge thick bubbly beige head that really lasted. Excellent display of lacework. Clear amber reddish color. Aroma of a mix of spices mainly ginger, cardamom, cinnamon. Also fruity and strong malty notes with again the spices coming through. Full bodied with a soft carbonation. Heavy sweet flavor. Lingering strong spicy finish.

Bottle. It pours bit hazy deep amber with a medium creamy light tan head. The aroma is light acid, cardemom, citrus, ginger and some dark ripe fruit. The flavour is light metallic, heavy spicy, sweet malty with notes of caramel, yeast, cardemom and ginger. Sweet spicy finish.

Bottled. Thx. SS Boutip for this. Burgundy coloured. Dense light brown head. ARoma: Loads of spice (cinnamon, coriander), fruits, herbs. Flavour: Medical and spiced. Sweetness, caramel, ripe fruits. Medium to full bodied. Fruity and sweet end.
Cloudy mahogany with a large beige head. Aroma had loads cardemum, ginger, cinnamon and roasted malt. Flavor had cardemum, roasted malt, cinnamon and ginger. Finished sweet and spicy. Awfull.

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of madsberg. Pours a clear dark brown with a creamy beige head. Aroma of overripe dark fruits and spices - some ginger. Very solid body, roasted dark malts, overripe fruit and loads of spices. Warming alcohol finish. 210810

2009 vintage, thanks to Fred.  Very good fluffycream-brownish head over very deep dark red-brown beer. Short burst of olive aroma; then alcohol, cake, vinosu, sweet - and coriander. More coriander, and more coriander, to the exclusion of everything else. Taste presents coriander, clove, allspice, liquorice, bit of cinnamon, orange peel. Spices jumble, unbalanced. Sweet, with alcohol strengthening this sweetness. Oh, and coriander. Speculoos  impression - under the coriander. Very slick, viscous, alcoholwarming, rich. But no way getting under the coriander onslaught. Im sorry, but the infernal weed utterly ruins it for me, despite some other promising features. Warming up, it gets outright unpalatable.

Shared by Rastacouere at RBSG grand tasting. A crazy Belgian ale with lots of spices. Huge spice aroma; caramel, more spice. Sweet, though the spices are well integrated. Lots of ginger in it. Interesting, and definitely more for winter!

Bottle @ Volo Launch Party.

       Aroma is rich malt, caramel and toffee, copper, pours a small toffee head. Flavour is fine malt, toffee, with a sponge toffee burn, nice earthiness too. Medium bodied, very well balanced, sweetish, warming, very drinkable. Great!

Big ups to sflpunk for this one. 2009 vintage. Pours a beautiful walnut colored pour with a nice off-white, frothy head. Aroma holds some really nice nectarine and peach notes, along with rosemary, tarragon (props). These two two concepts meld beautifully into a mulled cider profile, that has clove and pear in the background-- very spicy on the nose overall. Flavor takes a while to develop, then explodes with heavy heavy spice. Definitely a winter beer- reminds me of those gimmicky Christmas ales, but to be fair, it has a little more going on. Some molasses and caramel malt, but that beautiful nectarine profile from the aroma has been overpowered by the mulled spice. Bittersweet chocolate creeps in as well. Mouthfeel peaks aggressively after a couple seconds, then lingers, and I can feel the 10% ABV seeping into my gums. Not quite as good as the score indiciates, but an interesting beer, and worth trying.

Bottle at Pauls saison tasting.  Pours a hazy brown with a thin beige head.  Spicy, yeast and musk, bits of caramel, floral.  Medium bodied, sweet and full of caramel and old fruit, a hint of cocoa.  Finishes with more lingering spice.  Interesting.

bottle pours dark brown with a medium tan head.  Aroma is sweet vanilla and oak, with a brown sugar and yeast note.  Flavor is sweet bread malts upfront, turning bitter and metallic finish thats unpleasant.
Pours dark amber with a thick head.  aroma is yeast, caramel with a very rounded floral character.  Taste is much the same.  Finishes long and strong.

750mL bottle, 2007 vintage.  Poured deep, murky brown with a dense, well-retained khaki head.  The aroma picked up spicy, white peppery yeast, cloves, and a touch of oxidation over molasses, dates, and darker fruit.. a little metallic character right on the back.. overall dark, spicy, and intriguing.  The flavor found more of the dark fruit at the core paired with honey, dates, and molasses.. dry, earthy spices and peppery notes surrounded.. touches of banana joined the warm malts and tasty spices on the finish.. very good stuff!  Heavier-bodied with moderate-plus carbonation on the palate.. the alcohol was held in check, but made its presence felt on the breath after the drink and in the belly.. Id love to try a fresh one to see what the hops were supposed to do here, as they were faded to oblivion.

Great ruby red colour with a big frothy off white head. Metallic, apple aroma. Smooth spicy flavour with nutmeg, mixed spice and cinnamon. Tangy bitter finish. Becomes a little floral with toffee. Interesting beer.

Bottle. Dark brown with ruby highlights and a soft fizzy brown head. Big aroma of chocolate cherries, plums and hints at caramel. Big boozy flavour with toffee, alcohol, warm spice, molasses and dates. Although it is a cool May afternoon this is a tasty winter warmer.
Clear brown white beige head. Nice spicy bouquet : nutmeg coriander, cinnamon. Beer is full in body and finishes sweet but short. Nice balanced ale. The spice combo is original and well done. Smooth.

Brown bottle, 750 ml, 2009, purchased at Le Grand Duc (merci Jean-Marie!), savoured on May 16 2010; eye: copper with a ruby hue, clear, minimal effervescence, nice creamy beige head that turns into a thick sheet, light lacing; nose: anis, malt, liquorice, hops, light fruity; mouth: anis, malt, liquorice, hint of alcohol, hops, fruity, caramel, finale in malt with presence of spices, medium body, average carbonation, mildly sweet, rich and creamy texture, lightly bitter; overall: quite likable

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 750 ml, achetée chez Le Grand Duc (merci Jean-Marie!), savourée le 16 mai 2010; il : bronze avec une teinte rubis, claire, effervescence minime, belle mousse beige crémeuse qui se transforme en une épaisse couverture, légère dentelle; nez : anis, malt, réglisse, houblon, léger fruité; bouche : anis, malt, réglisse, pointe dalcool, houblon, fruité, caramel, finale en malt avec présence dépices, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture riche et crémeuse, légèrement amère; en résumé : bien aimé

Pours a deep copper hue with aggressive, light beige head, giving way to minimal lacing.  Aroma is slightly boozy with an interesting spicy character, hard for me to identify, but pleasant nonetheless.  Taste is of caramelized fruits nicely offset by sharp notes from the spices and alcohol content.  Finishes very smoothly, owing to the soft carbonation level.  Quite enjoyable!

Pours deep mahogany into a Trappist glass. Off-white head recedes to mottle surface. Dark caramel and roasted nut aromas. Smooth with upfront sweet almonds turning to dark dried pit fruit  in the middle and onto a lasting dusty warming chocolate and licorice burn.
spicy nose, dark pour with nice beige foam, some lacing, spicy and malty flavor, nutmeg, mace, anise odd aftertaste but good. maybe needs aging

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2011 2007 bottle at the 2010 March Metro Detroit tasting. Poured a cloudy brown with a slight red hue. Aroma had notes of sweet fruit and caramel with undertones of grains and yeast. Flavor was nice with a combination of yeast, alcohol and some sweet notes with a bit of sweet fruits coming out in the finish.
I dunno, man...this one just really wasnt a stand-out for me. Sweet, a bit of spice, some yeast characteristics...just nothing to write home about.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2010 Kens botle.  very good, and worthy of Charlevoix as world beaters, but not the lupulus.  Big bubbly head on dark body.  Yeasty aromas of Belgian yeast.  Taste of licorish.  It is sweet,  it is lacey.  There is some white pepper, cardomon.  It is very drinkable.Lateral tasting at Volo v. Lupulus, and Hibernus is even a clearer winner.

75cl bottle...not shared! This pours light gold with a huge head. The aroma is hoppy, floral and light citrus. Taste is all hops, it reminded me of drinking beer in Europe on the terrace. This was a sweet finish that lasted a long time. In fact i woke up in the middle of the night and could still taste it. Overall this is the nicest beer i have had in a long time. So nice i bought another bottle to save for a special occasion.

If Jagermeister was made as a beer, the 2009 would be it.
Great herbal/floral with orange, syrupy and a nice long finish.
One of the best Ive tasted.

750 ml bottle, shared with kw group.  Thanks for the share Jeff!  Pours browny, with a big foamy head, which leaves a ton of lacing.  Aroma and flavour are big, sprucy, sweet, herbal hops.  Alcohol is very subtle, well hidden.  Very nice!
(on bottle) Red-brown, huge beige head. cassis, old leaves, vinourous nand some toothpaste too. Creamy, malty, soft mouth.  Lots of alcohol and malt warmth. Heavy belgian-yeast finish.

Glad that the "retired" mention now has to be taken off since they just ressuscitated this one, in new shape of bottle with printings on it.  14,29$ AT PELUSO, so all of humans that are not Québécois can expect to pay an awful lot pf money to taste that, and I recommend you do because this clearly is a world-class Grand Cru.  A beer clearly rivalizing against DDCs magnificient Rigor Mortis as best Quadrupel/Abt in, forget Québec, probably North America!  Nectar-like texture, with divinely appropriate carbonation and texture.  Taste is way too complex to be fully described by the words plums, dates, dry figs, brown sugar, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, coriander, pepper and above expected leafy hoppiness...  Gotta buy some more soon before they all disapear...  Amazing brew.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2010 Bottle. 2009 vintage (released january 2010). Dark brown pour with frothy tan head. Aroma: Lots of spices, cloves, coriander and cinnamon. Good belgian yeast aroma too, sweet malt and a hint of something metallic thats the only throw-off. Taste is just so spicy, followed by the maltiness, it gets very fruity too, pears and apples and a solid hop and malt finale, relatively present alcohol. Palate is very rich, smooth and silky.

750 ml bottle shared by tupalev at a kw group tasting. 2007 vintage. pours deep maroon with a smallish tan head. dark fruit with spice and hebs in the nose. the flavour was mostly dark fruit with the spice adding complexity. the finish was dry and the body was light and playful considering the abv. really nice stuff, thx for the share jeff!

750ml bottle.  Thanks for opening this one Shane, never thought Id get to try this.  Pours a deep cola brown with a good sized off with head leaving some nice lacing.  Some lemon zest, slightly tart berry fruits, dates and a bit of Belgian candy sugar in the nose as well as in the flavor.  A very interesting brew, kick ass looking bottle.
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Red brown in color with a good sized beige head. Aroma is of perfume, floral, caramel, and clove. Taste is caramel, light floral, yeast, fruit and clove.

The aroma is spicy and sour with notes of raspberries, caramel, fruits and slight balsamic. Flavour of caramel, fruit, sweet malt, yeast and molasses sugar. A little unbalanced. Cloudy dark amber with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of dried fruit, brown sugar, spices and yeast, and a vineous alcohol note. Herbal flavour with rosemary in particular, plums and dark sugar, and a touch of alcohol.

Bottle. Blindtasting @ Thewolf. Pours a dark unclear brown with a creamy white head. Nose is yeast, sour, malty, caramel, some dark fruits. Quite complex nose. Medium and smooth palate. Full, sticky, oily and vinous. Nice one.
Bottle. High and creamy lasting light brown head. Hazy red brown body. Powerful prune fruit caramel coffee aroma. Mild creamy berries caramel fruity flavor. Low carbonation. Long sweet aftertaste.

From bottle, blind #1, courtesy of thewolf. Pours dark and hazy brown with a small tan head. Fruity, light sourish and roasted malt aroma towards vague spiced note.
