Bottle. [thank you, Boutip]
[Bottle #1 in the Kolding Blindtasting, 20th June 2009]
Pours clear red-brown with a large, creamy, off-white head. Great duration. Arom a is super fruity, plums, chocolate, yeast, ginger, red apples. Great creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is lightly vinious, plums, spices, chocolate and raspeberries. Light warming. Damn, this is nice.

2007 bottle thanks to bu11zeye. The smell is malts, sweet, caramel, sugary, and chocolate.  The look is amber red in color, cloudy, with a decent beige colored head.  The taste is sweet, caramel, malts, and fruits.
Dark brown body with a medium tan head.  Aroma of light spices and some dark fruits--prunes, dates.  Flavor is anise, spices, and sweet dates.  Nice carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2010 750ml 2007 bottle. Was eager to have this beer and I was not disappointed. This beer suddenly appeared at the bottle shop. I suspect is was lost in the back store so it may have been poorly stored. Poured really dark amber. Very nice looking (like the bottle). Aroma is dark fruits, some yeast. Hints of alcohol and raisins. Medium carbonation, good mouthfeel. Taste is yeasty, a tiny bit metallic, prunes. Almost no trace of alcohol. Incredible balance, very well crafted. Price is quite high (13.99$ CAN) but its almost worth it just to look at the bottle. Among the best beers Ive had ! Rating #112. (9,4,9,4,17;4.3
From bottle at a tasting.
Appearance : Dark amber

Aroma : Lots of spices, cloves light hint of raisins.

Taste : Cloves, spices, some dark fruits and raisins.

Overall : HUGE disapointment. Too much spices. You can feel the original beer underneath but it is burried under layers and layers of spices. The other bottle I had was the 2007 and was 1 year old. With a bit of luck the spices on this one will fade out eventually. Looks like the whole Dominus Vobiscum line got spiced up in the last year and I dont like this (they say its coming from the yeast). I guess I will now drown my tears with some Lupulus (which is not a spice bomb and is freaking awesome !)

2007 bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  deep brown pour with a cream head.  nose is slightly sour with sugar and fruits.  not bad on the palate with a heavy yeast flavor that finishes with some sourness and is very well carbonated.

2007 bottle from glouglouburp... 

i tasted this over two days as it was too weird and sickly sweet to finish in one... 

pours hazy a rich coppery dark brown with  an orange tinted off white head. 

the aroma is really strange... sweet caramel covered cardamom and golden raisins.... thats it.  on the second day the cardamom subsides to reveal notes of floral yeast, spices (especially cinnamon) wood and licorice. 

the flavor is odd... it reminds me of jagermeister... a terribly sweet mix of cardamom, licorice, fennel, molasses, clove, golden raisins and caramel... yuck! but for some reason it keeps drawing me back in (i DO like me some jager!). on the second day the sweetness starts to take over... it becomes even more prominent but shows some notes of wood, toasted nuts, sweet sticky barley and some cocoa butter. 

it is medium to rich bodied yet somehow stops short of cloying. alcohol helps dry it out (it tries anyway) but is not sensed anywhere else. not my bag... 6/4/6/3/13/3.1

(750ml bottle, 2007 vintage)   Pours a cloudy amber-brown body with a medium beige head.  Aroma of mustiness, nuts, earthiness, dark fruit, clove, and yeast.  Flavor of yeast, dark fruit, light clove, and caramel malt with nice carbonation.

2007 Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Pours with a large, off-white head and a hazed amber body. Aroma is hard to describe, caramel, fruity with molasses. Taste is fruity, phenols, fruit, caramel, toffee and very sweet. lively bubbles.

Bottle. Body-reddish muddy brown with a medium ring of bubbles. Nose-grass, strong, clove, unsweet portion of honey and molasses, brown sugar. Taste-Mexican food, amber Belgian candi sugar, tobacco on the back end, some pool water.

Beautiful bottle, thanks Dany.  Pours a nice deep chestnut red with a large khaki head.  Aroma is really sweet darker fruits, especially dates and figs.  Pretty sugary in the mouth, much like a quad but a little lighter in body.  Big on figs, dates, honey, and rum sugars.  Good, nothing mind blowing but nice.  Too light and spritzy in the mouth for this style.  The bottle is really neat though.

Bottle pours hazy brown color with off white head.  Aroma is dark fruit, with a spicy caramel malt sweetness.  Maybe something tart.  Flavor is dark sweetness, dark fruit, slightly tart, and finishes way too sweet.  I would have rated higher but this was just too sweet for me.

Slightly reddish-brown.  Cloudy.  Deep fruity notes (almost tomato, but also beet and plum) with light chocolate.  Big tangy fruits (tomato, dark fruits).  Kind of tart in the finish.  Decent, but shattering no earth.

2007 bottle @ kp party. Hazy medium warm brown color with nice beige head. Sweet nutty aroma is earthy with lots of dark fruit. Lots of bread crust in the body. Fig jam and nuts too. Very nice, the carbonation but not so bad. Jammy with a nice blend of berries, molasses, dates, and figs. Interesting.

Bouteille de 750ml vieillie plus dun an. Nos yeux contemplent une bière de couleur rubis légèrement trouble ainsi quun col de mousse imposant et durable. Au nez on découvre des arômes de raisin rouge, dépices, de poivre, de vieux caramel, de prune sous un fond dalcool. En bouche le corps est rond avec une effervescence moyenne. On goûte des saveurs de raisin rouge, de prune, danis, de pain brun, de poivre, dalcool, de cerise confîte et de madère. La finale dure et dure longtemps. Quelle complexité!!

Date: January 03, 2009
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, Cellar Party
Vintage: 2007
Appearance: clear dark red, wispy beige head, bits of drippy lace
Aroma: sweet estery aroma, nice spicyness, dark caramel sweetness
Flavor: sweet dark caramel candy flavor, nice balancing spicy character
Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 14/20

Bottle from 2007 - Beautiful deep chestnut body, creamy light brown head, some sparkle; Very fruity almost vinous sharp nose, very special with way to much cinnamon when it warms; Huge soft carbonation on huge powerful body, deep with a warm sweetness and a very balanced vinous part; Long warm finish, some cinnamon notes, lots of malt warmth again slightly vinous. Very special beer with lots of personality.

Bottle shared by emacgee. Thanks Ethan. Nose is very spicy and herb--basil, oregano, yeast, sweet malt. Flavor is a little less complex than expected, a big brew but not too much going on other than the spices.  Good and weird at the same time.

Magnifique bouteille de 750 ml achetée chez Épicerie Lauzière (Drummondville, QC). Arôme: Odeur dépices avec une pointe dorigan et de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est brune très foncé. Présence dun énorme col beige mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de chocolat, de caramel fruité et dépices. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de caramel fruité en arrière goût. (Rating #2125)

Bottle shared by Ethan.  One of the last of a long night, and it didnt do much to distinguish itself, unfortunately.  Dark hazy brown pour with big off-white head.  Spice and herbs, though nothing very distinct.  We suspected oregano, which was surprising.  Mild fruits and candied sugar. A bit peppery.

Big thanks to Cletus. Pours a deep murky brown with a creamy two finger head. The nsoe is very spicy and herbal, sweet and spicy, oregano, fruity esters, yeasty. Very spicy and herbal on the flavor, sweet spices, candy, nice hop feel, nutmeg and allspice, fruity. Palate is spicy and fruity with a soft carbonation. Very tasty Belgian.

Appearance: Pours a near opaque, dark brown, near black body with a thin, fizzy, off-white head.

Smell: Spicy, sweetish scent of caramel-coated bread crumbs and nuts with background notes of dried herbs and fruit.

Taste: Toasted caramel maltiness with a mild sweetness. Heavy-handed dose of fresh spices, including cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger. Slight herbal character. A bit of plum and golden raisin fruitiness. Slight nuttiness. Not too terribly much in the way of either hop flavor or bitterness. Small dollop of milk chocolate. Malty, though drying finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Rather well carbonated, I must say.

Drinkability: This is the most enjoyable French Canadian brew Ive had in quite some time. Displays a nice level of complexity while keeping that ABV% safety at bay.

750 ml bottle, 2007.  Gushed a bit of foam but settled quickly in the glass to a thin tan.  Dark brown with clear topaz edges.  Nose is musty caramel, fig and nectarine.  Soft and muted; sticky and kind of flat.  Taste is toffee and raisin with an earthy bitterness.  Some spice with clove and cinnamon.

Bottle acquired from Phyl21ca many moons ago poured into a snifter.

Pours a dark mahogany that shows through as a clear deep copper when held up to light.  The head was a massive off-white crown that lingered as a one0inch cap for the duration leaving tons of lacing.

The aroma was very surprising and dominated by spices and a yeasty sweetness - definitely some coriander, ginger and a candi apple sweetness.  There is bits of dark fruit with figs and some caramel, but the spiciness was the most striking feature.

The taste follows the aroma and has the interesting spicy yeast flavor that dominates with figs and red apples playing a part as well.  There was lots of caramel malts underpinning everything else but the melding of the spices with the Belgian yeast and fruit sweetness was very good.

The mouthfeel is unbelievably creamy with lots of carbonation and completely coats the palate.

This is one of the more interesting Belgian strong ales I’ve ever tasted and the spiciness made it very complex and very original.  The alcohol was nearly non-existent so drinkability is pretty high given the size of the beer.  Worth a try if you can find it.

2007 vieillie 1 an. Bouteille partager avec Jean-Nic. Nectar ambre a 10%, sirupeux, malter sucrer et epicer. Delicieuse.

2007 aged 1 year. Splited the bottle with Jean-Nic. Amber syrupy nectar, 10% abv, malty sweet and spicy. Delicious.
Huge thanks to glouglouburp for this. 750 ml bottle. Beautiful amber with huge cream like head. Tastes of wonderful spice, clove and mild sweet fruit. Another great brew sent to me from Dany.

750ml from Glouglouburp. Thanks, Dany, from a trade a few months back. My initial impression of the beer was that this is a jumped up version of the truly fine dubbel this brewery produces. A fairly viscous dark pour with a sizable head, this is a highly spiced strong ale, with the complexity of a quad but the drinkability of a milder dark ale. Dangerous. The nose is very rich and appealing, filled with spice, quirky fruit characteristics, and an unexpected chile note, like ancho rub or something close to that. As the beer settles in, it is the fruit and hops that tend to come through the overall thick beer. The finish is lengthy, with just a trace of dry funk in there to make it quirkier than you thought. 
All in all, yet another example of how fine this brewery is.

Bottle at Paul’s Gathering: Pours effervescent hazy amber with a thick tan head. The aroma is interesting- coriander, herbal notes of lavender, Belgian phenols, and a soft Belgian malt presence (fig). Fluffy mouthfeel with a softly sweet flavor which is balanced by a complex herbal spiciness. Honey and candy-sugar sweetness is there, yet it remains soft along with toasted coriander and mild herbal suggestion to spice things up. The finish has residual herbal notes along with slim toasted Belgian malt character. Very unique and complex. Great stuff!

22oz bottle courtesy of Beerlando at the Solan’s Mom Throwdown. Pours a super dark red, almost blackish brown with a thick foamy beige head. Nose is tons of apple and spicy yeast. The taste of this one really knocks you over with its sweetness. Its maybe a little too sweet. There is some spices in there in an attempt to add some balancing spiciness (ginger maybe?) but its so sweet. Only at the end do the hops make a fleeting appearance for a rather rough dose of bitterness. Bit of a hazelnut praline finish thats quite tasty. Alcohol is very well hidden.

Deep ruby in colour with a long lasting beige coloured head, excellent lacing.  The aroma is yeasty, lots of dark fruits, plums, raisins, some caramel sweetness, a bit musty.  The flavour is very smooth and creamy, lots of plums, yeast, excellent sweetness, well balanced with just a bit of alcohol.  Creamy and lightly warming mouthfeel, medium body, moderate carbonation.  Finishes very long, sweet with just a bit of alcohol.
This is very refreshing.  Charlevoix has always made good beer but this one sort of came out of nowhere.  The future is exciting with this brewery.
750ml bottle from the Marché Jovi in Gatineau, Quebec.
Opened on May 8, 2008.
Vintage 2007.

750 courtesy of Glouglouburp.  Pours brown with a red tint and a thin tan head.  Smells spicy and earthy with some fruity hints.  Tastes sweet and of fresh spruce with a spicy finish.  This brewer makes some impressive beers!
Sampled at RBSG.  Brownish read pour with nice fluffy head.  Aromas of sweet yeasty malts and some dark fruits.  Flavors were more fruit and sweet sugar and spice.  Yummy

Much thanks to Dmac for sharing this one. Pours out a dark brown, slightly copperish with a large foamy white head. Aroma is a bouquet of roses, peach, brown sugar, nutmeg and some yeasty notes. Taste is complex with a very nice mouthfeel.  Floral notes with fruit, yeast and some nice spice going on in there too, very well hidden alcohol content and extremely well balanced with many different flavors going on, and they all work. Well done

750 ml bottle from glouglouburp, thanks Dany. Pours a deep dark reddish brown with a large thick full creamy beige head. Aroma of flowers and perfume, flroal hops, very sweet, brown sugar, cinnamon, perhaps a touch of mint. Full bodied with average carbonation. Flavor very similiar to the aroma with notes of prefume, lavender, spicey yet oh so drinkable. No trace of the 10% ABV in either the aroma or the flavor. Great beer thanks for this suprise Dany.

Bottle generously shared by mreusch. Pours a bright, clear, reddish-brown with a creamy, light tan head. The nose is a spicy, cinnamon stick, brown sugar, round malt and some other indistinguishable spice note that makes me think of Christmas. Medium-bodied, creamy and silky with a lightly dry mineral finish. A beautiful blend of sweet, round malt with a supporting dry, lightly funky yeast note and the same great blend of spices found on the nose. This is a damn fine beer. Thanks a ton for sharing this with us, Matt!

2007 bottle shared by mreusch, and man was I blown away by this beer.  What a pretty pour with a thick tan had that quickly fades into a nice lacing. The color is a clear dark brown. Aroma is killer.  At first pour its a brown sugar and sweet dark bread malts.  However, with just a few moments that fades into almost a completely different beer.  Aroma becomes a spice dominant, almost like a Belgian-y Christmas beer. Taste is light black raisin bread with woodsy sides and a lightly dry yet sweat finish.  Has a nice mouthfeel with a medium light body and a few spikes of carbonation.  However, I keep feeling the beer on my cheeks.  Very wonderful beer and thank you very much Matt.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: 2007 750ml bottle, with a big thank you to Glouglouburp!  Pours a clear dark amber with reddish tint, nice fizzy tan head that maintains a thin covering, spots of lace.  Aroma is spicy, with light citrus hops and too many other components I can’t seem to adequately describe.  Flavor is also spicy with a more subdued citrus hops, and all around is very impressive.  This beer pushes my personal boundaries of spice and sweet more than any other I’ve come across and am very impressed, excellent stuff.  Thanks again Dany!

750 ml bottle - thanks after4ever!!  pours thick and reddish brown; huge tan head brings out some serious aromas of cream, spice and vegis; slmost like liquid thai food for a bit; drinks with full body and flavors or dates, chewy citrus and little spice; nose is to die for and the flavor is just about there too; not quite the love fest of the Lupulus, but this is still a kick ass beer on its own

Bouteille 750ml (2007). De couleur brune-rouge et voilée. Nez de levures épicées (clou de girofle, moyen d’anis, léger de muscade et de poivre, notes de cannelle et de coriandre) et fruitées (prunes, léger de dates, notes de raisins et de pommes), malté de caramel sucré, moyen de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches) aux notes florales ainsi que des notes d’alcool et de noix. Moyenne-ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-fort et une texture crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (prunes, dates, léger de pommes rouges, notes de cerises, d’agrumes et de raisins vineux) et d’épices (clou de girofle, muscade, moyen d’anis, notes de cannelle et de coriandre) lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de caramel sucré avec des notes de pain et de sucre brun. Parallèlement, l’on retrouve un léger goût d’alcool aux petites notes réchauffantes jusqu’en finale, où l’on assiste également à un regain de goût épicé légèrement asséchant (poivre, traces de gingembre) ainsi qu’à une moyenne amertume de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches), légèrement floral et aux notes terreuses. Post-goût long et un peu sec, moyennement amer de houblon herbeux et légèrement floral avec une goût fruité (moût de raisins, pelures de prunes et de pommes, notes de zest d’agrumes), un léger goût d’alcool (notes de muscade toujours présente) et des notes de noix.

A dark brown ale with a thick brown moka head. Beautiful to see. In aroma, sweet caramel with loads of orange peels, vanilla and hops. Fragrants is the word. In mouth, a very sweet syrupy ale with cloves, cinnamon, treacle, and sustained hops bitterness, tingly spicyness. Rich and smooth in mouth. Roasted notes in finale. Wonderful. Bought at Jovi, Gatineau, 12.99$.

Sample from wetherels (looked that one up now) bottle at RBSG; Nose of flowers, fruitiness, caramel, and ginger; clear amber with a small beige head; flavor of dark fruit, brown sugar, and caramel. Guess I was the only one still rating when this one was opened!

750, capped. Thanks, Dany! Slightly hazy dark brown with ruby highlights. Thick, dense, creamy tan head with wooly sheets of lace. Huge raw fresh black licorice nose, along with some piquant funk much higher in the bouquet. Currants and other dark tree fruits under that. Rich, creamy body with delectably blended dark fruits, brown sugar, menthol, and other heavy dark flavors swirling around. Pretty astonishingly inventive stuff. Lovely.

750ml bottle. Thanks to Dickonsonbeer for sharing. Poured a copper color with amber hues and a white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of ginger, yeasty, and quite a bit spicy. Tastes is spiced, full of ginger, with dark fruits, caramel malts, nuts, and finishes nicely.  This really enjoyed this one.

Thanks to Glouglouburp for hooking me up with these.  Pours a deep amber with a thcik beige head.  I get a log of spicy phenolics here along with some piney mint character, with some good doughy nutty light chocolate malts and some sweet caramel.  Dusty earthy flavor, more phenols, good sweet caramel and big belgian malts, some leather, coriander, dried apricots, green apples, red tart apple skin, and a nice smooth finish.  Great Belgian strong dark ale.

Courtesy beerlando. Pours an orangish brown color with a big, foamy white head that leaves lacing all over the glass. The aroma shows notes of sweet caramel, toasted bicuits, spices, and some earthy hops. The flavor follows with the caramel malts and earthy hops most prevalent along with ginger and other earthy notes. The flavor is very uniquie. Medium-full bodied with a long bitter sweet finish.A lot of stuff going on with this one. An interesting one for sure.

Poured a hazy, brown red color with a medium sized, light tan head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of ginger, dark fruits, caramel malts, molasses, nuts, and a bit of roast. Taste of sweeter brown sugar, caramel malts, ginger, coriander, and a nutty, sweeter finish, with a bit of alcohol to dry everything out.  Thanks Paul!

750ml bottle shared courtesy of dickinsonbeer. Poured a medium and cloudy amber brownish color with a small sized off white head. Aromas of spices, ginger, dark fruits, and bready. Tastes of dark fruits, ginger, spices, and other fruitiness. Light to medium alcohol in the finish.

Thanks to dickinsonbeer for sharing this. Pours a lightly hazy brown with lots of amber/ruby notes and a medium bubbly off white head.  Aroma of ginger, odd spices, a spice I cant pinpoint, brown sugar, cinnamon, bready, dark fruits, molasses and Belgian yeast esters.  Flavor of brown sugar, ginger, malty and sweet, Belgian yeast esters, some citrus, cinnamon and just plain spicy...one to open up on Christmas!

Pours a dark, hazy, rusty brown color.  A large, foamy, cream colored head shows excellent retention, leaving spotty patches of lacing behind.  The nose shows a distinct ginger bread note that Ive yet to encounter in another beer.  Other elements include glazed biscuit, floral hops, caramel, and camphor.  Very interesting.  There are definitely some saison elements in there.  Flavors, too, are as unique as they come.  Biscuity malts are enhanced by minty spices and floral hops, as well as that crisp ginger snap note that is so unusual.  Medium-full bodied and finely carbonated.  Finishes semi-dry, with a sweet aftertaste.  Very nice.  This brewery certainly does some off-the-wall beers.

Thanks to Ken for this one.  Black body, thin creamy beige head.  Aromas of apples, spice, caramel sweetness, like apple pie in a glass.  Flavor is very sweet apple, caramel, becomes cloying, similar to apple butter.  Light on the palate.

Bottle @ ORL throwdown, courtesy of Beerlando. Pours a fairly haze free garnet with a puffy one finger cream head. Amazing aroma, citrus and floral hops abound, highly spiced. Ginger stands out the most, followed by cinnamon, nutmeg and pepper, a hint of lemon. Mmm, the flavor is straight up gingerbread or gingersnaps. Ginger is undeniable, but pair with a spicy sweet maltiness and a touch of hop bitterness. This is fantastic. Fluffy mouthfeel, tons of bubble. For all the sweetness and spices, they did a great job balancing this beer, nothing sticks out too much. Very tasty, plus the alcohol is hidden wonderfully.

Bottle... SMAACMSM O-Town Throwdown, Part Sept... Lightly hazed burnt orange ale with a mid-sized, creamy, khaki-colored head. Fantastic, everlasting retention. Phenolic, earthy nose. Full-bodied with a whole-milk mouthfeel and prickly carbonation. Favors the sweet side of balance. Medium to heavy residual sugar; moderate hop and ethanol bitterness. Caramel or praline. Lengthy, sweet, spicy finish. Kudos to Beerlando for bringing this one to share!

bottle courtesy beerland: pours a dark caramel brown good sized tan head sit atop. aroma is a sweet honey, spicey, odd caramel malt. flavour is a great sweet spice, honey, good caramel, some good floral hops also.

Courtesy Beerlando. Brownish red pour with big carbonation and a thick tan head. Sweet caramel hoppy aroma. Fig, prune, dark fruit, caramel taste. Finishes kind of sweet. What a crazy blend of tastes and by and large the strangest beer at our tasting.

Courtesy Beerlando.  Pours a cloudy dark maroon, with a small light tan head.  Smells of big spice, some sour acidic fruit, clove, and even some mint.  Ginger comes to mind as well.  The flavor was very earthy, big on that ginger, with lots of funked out fruits, and malts abound.  Very weird and unique brew.  Tons of different flavors seemed to be blended together here.  Definitely interesting, but not really my thing.
Throwdown. Spicy and floral aroma with ginger, and perhaps gardenia. Sweet and spicy, with caramel and bread, a touch tart. Really characterful and fun. Would love to get more of this!
poured a dark brown with a creamy head  sweet malty aroma of spice and  fruits slightly alchohol very well balanced. thanks to all at the orlando throwdown

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2008 Poured from a 750 ml bottle.  Misty mahagony body.  Floral, spicy, apple and perfume aroma; orange peel, fennel seed, anise.  Some pear and honey sweetness; lively, and carefully complex.  Spiced chardonnay dry-sweet flavor; soft bit of floral spice, anise, brown sugar and cinnamon malts; flutters back and forth between this crisp floral character and a warm, doughy sweetness, which in light of all this firm spice character seems like gingerbread cookie dough.  Pillowy silk mouthfeel; an easy balance of briskness and density recalling the best belgian examples; finishes with some brown sweetness of nutmeg and malt, somewhat dry and drawing out slowly.  Regally balanced, a conspicuously, unmistakeably sophisticated offering; clean, vaporous, and slyly evocative.  Thanks Ken!

Courtesy of kmweaver. Hazy dark amber body with a medium light tan head. Big herbal nose with lots of spicy hops, some toffee, dark fruit and anise. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter with toffee, raisins, herbs, flowers and cookie dough. Medium body is very soft with moderate carbonation.

(750ml bottle, thanks kmweaver) Large beige head atop hazy dark brown body.  Aroma is medium sweet, clove, white wine, dusky, allspice.  Taste is moderately sweet, flower, nutmeg, allspice, some alcohol, caramel, peach.  Medium-full body, some stickiness.

750mL bottle, 2007 vintage, courtesy of Glouglouburp.  Thanks, Dany!  Pours a dark, clear bold ruby-wooden color; thin, light-tan head with patchy medium-bubbled lacing.  Very pleasant aroma, showing cherry cola, spices, and warm apple pie; nice demonstration of soft spicing and cola; a soft red-wine / vinous note.  Good levels of carbonation.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: cherry cola, soft brown sugar and clove and spices; intricate spicing; good levels of acidity and citrus bitterness; nicely composed, unique beer.  Lengthy finish: breadiness and solid yeast notes, lingering spice and cloves and pepper.

Dark reddish gold color with an off white head.  The aroma is quite spicy with sweet malt and pumpkin pie spices (minus the pumpkin).  A certain wine character is also present that adds depth to the overall experience of this beer.  Flavor is very representative of its aroma but with a hint of bitterness on the finish that balances with the sweetness of the malt and the beers spiciness.  Excellent, I am glad to have tried this rare treat!
This beer is tremendous.  Aroma is complex and delicious.  Tons of baking spices, but none overpower or dominate the lightly sweet, delicious flavor.  Thanks a million Dany.

Glouglouburp sent me this rarity all the way from Montreal in a recent trade. Thanks Dany! Shared at Sean and Ryans apartment tasting with Brad, DenverLogan, WeeHeavySD, wetherel and many others. Two words for this beer: unique and intriguing. Hazy amber color with thin beige head and lace. Awesome appetizing and complex aroma with notes of licorice, peppery nutmeg, cinnamon spice and a tart berry character. Malty flavor with nuances of lemon peel, orange and coriander. Fairly thin bodied, but the lasting flavor and good carbonation make for a great palate. Tasty!

Sampled at Sean and Ryans tasting. Poured a clear reddish-amber. Sweet aroma of lemons, malt, hops. Taste is sweet and bright, of malt, citrus hops and a hint of spices. Mouthfeel is a bit syrupy. Really nice taste and very drinkable.

Gift bottle from Francois_MTL and tasted at Sean and Ryans party.  Dark amber color.  small flully offwhite head.  Sweet malty profile.  Easy to drink.  Wonderful and delicious.  I like this better than Lupulus.  Yum!

750ml bottle shared by andrew.  thanks again man..... poured a dark mahogany brown with a very fluffy off-white head.... aroma was initially sweet and heavily spiced up (in a good way) with a huge amount of cloves, nutmeg, and some others to round it out..... flavor didnt sway too far from the nose.  spices combined with sweet caramel malt intertwined with each other in a seemless way.  truly excellent mouthfeel as it was very full, creamy, and carbonated at just the right level..... not too much wrong with this beer. i could easily have given this another point.

750ml bottle. thanks to Glouglouburp for this one. pours brown with off white head. nose is very spiced with nutmeg, cloves, cinnamon, and licorice. flavors of cinnamon, spice, caramel, chocolate, and licorice. full mouth feel. a great BSA that reminds me of pannepot a bit. tasty.

Très belle bouteille verte de 750 ml. Arômes sucrés de fruits rouges et de caramel. Robe bourgogne coiffée dune magnifique mousse qui marque le verre et tient longtemps. Cette bière exprime une grande complexité en bouche, toutes les saveurs étant soutenues par une solide base maltée. On retrouve une touche fruitée (cerises et pruneaux) ainsi quune présence dépices (muscade, réglisse et poivre). Lalcool est bien dissimulé et réchauffe délicatement la gorge en arrière-goût. Excellent !

[1120-20080226] 750mL (c/o HogTownHarry, w/ him, biegaman, blankboy, GregClow, jerc, mds). Ginger cherry aroma with a bit of spicy yeast. Hazy, dark red body with a quick foamy light tan head. Sweet spicy yeast flavour has mild vegetable mid-tones and hidden alcohol. Medium body. Definitely interesting.

A 750 ml. bottle shared with Quevillon. The color is dark brown with a beige head. The taste is of malt and sweetfruits like orange and dried cherries. There is also a note of spicies. All this combined makes it a great strong belgium beer and another near perfect beer from Charlevoix.

Pre Tasting 08 PP Belgian Fest w/ my girlfriend Cyn, Bartzilla and Galtscat.  750 via trade with Glougoburp, thanks Dany.  Pours amber with a 1 finger tan head.  Nose is big orange with lots of citrus.  Taste is sweet, complex, hints of a variety of things, little citrus dark orange, syruppy nice unique and great!!

750ml Bottle, acquired in a trade with Glouglouburp (thanks again Dany!).  Dark mahogany, huge bubbly brown tinted head, log lasting with good lacing.  Nice spicy aroma, lots of malt, musty, with hints of fruit and tartness.  Taste is intense - tons of spicy malt, lots of ear warming alcohol, very very sweet.  Chewy.  There are a ton of spice notes and I wish I had a better palette to pick all of them out.  Almost of Christmas cake like fruity character to it.  Complex stuff here, this one is a sipper that rewards every single sip.  Very good.

750 mL bottle shared with Ben (thanks!) from Jovi, served cool in a tulip glass. MR 15/08.
App.:  Very dark mahogany, hazy, decent light tan head.
  
Aroma:  Lots of spices (cinnamon, ginger, clove, allspice?), some cola-like herbals, some lemon-citrus, chocolate, vanilla, a bit of dark dried fruit, definite bread crust.
  
Palate:  Medium-full body, silky, soft but full effervescence, some sharp bubbles.
  
Flav.:  More of the cola herbals than the nose, similar warm spices, a good dose of dried fruit, some yeast/bread dough, hints of lemon/citrus; a touch of tartness, fairly sweet, some warming alcohol, and a vanilla/chocolate aftertaste. 

A masterpiece!  Huge, complex and delicious.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry, blankboy, biegaman, mabel, jerc & mds - courtesy of HogTownHarry. Ruby-amber with a small head. Aroma of sweet malt and pungent spice - a lot going on in there, very nice. Complex flavour as well - caramel malt, dark sugar, tingly spices (nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice). Damn good!

Dark brown with a medium beige head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma is sweet malt, raisins, plums, mint and yeast. Very little alcohol for a 10% beer. Flavour si sweet malt, dates, yeast, alcohol, candy sugar, spices, mint and brown sugar. Full body with medium carbonation. A very good beer.

Thanks to puzzl.  Poured a clear ruby color with a beige head.  the aroma was yeasty, fruity and sweet with a hint of tartness on the finish.  Also some notes of spice and mint.  The flavor was mildly sweet and fruity.  The finish was semi-dry and spiced.  Some more mint here as well.  Medium body.

Body is dark brown with a large tan frothy foamy head.  Big aroma of spices and candied sugar with yeasty and malty fullness.  Beer is sweet upfront with extremely rich texture malts.  Fruity, yeasty and complex which is chewy and full. Tasty and sweet throughout with a touch of alcohol on the way down. This ranks up there with some of the better Belgian strong ales out there/

Bottle (750ml) shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, biegaman, mabel, jerc & mds -- courtesy of HogTownHarry. 2007 vintage. Pours a deep ruby-brown with a large lasting foamy beige head. Sweet, malty aroma along with spices and fruit. Flavours delicious and refreshing! Spicy (similar to Pumpkin beer spices) with caramel malt and fruit. Alcohols well hidden. Medium bodied, creamy mouthfeel. Very enjoyable, I loved it!

Thanks to puzzl for sharing this.  Rich brown coloured brew with a thick pillowy tan head.  Quite a sweet lovely maltiness, plums and dates with a fresh toasted wheaty maltiness.  Spicy and yeasty with a lovely fruity sweetness.  Chewy, sweet, wheaty and very tasty.  Herbal/spicy yeastiness.

Lightly bready, slightly boozy aroma, a touch sour, with a good bit of candi sugar. Woody yeast. Sublte but complex. Has a very nice sweetness in the flavor, quite mellow and there is a little bit of alcohol. A distinct woodiness, not really that of oak but more of raw carpentry wood (something like that), like one would experience in a woodshop. Quite different but quite enjoyable.

Bottle: Poured a deep clear brown color ale with a huge foamy head with great retention and some nice lacing. Aroma of spices (anis) with great Belgian malt touch with some light sweet notes also noticeable. Taste is dominated by anis with some creamy sweet caramel Belgian malt some light spicy notes. Full body with great creamy texture and some perfect carbonation with no apparent alcohol. The only negative point that I could notice is that spices tends to be too heavy at some point but apart from that everything is perfect.

Dark mahogany color, with a frothy beige head, leaving laces, yeasty, spicy, fruity nose of peaches, mangoes, plums, and candied manderine peel, with a subtle kind of blackcherry wineyness, with some toasted, caramelized malts, with a faint chocolatey note, within some port, Grand Marnier liquorish effluvia, a nice spiced herbal hop, developing some marvelous, lavender and rose aromas follow through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, fruity, sweet malt character, with a very nice spicy accent of coriander, nutmeg, clove, o good flowery herbal hop note of lavender, rose petal, with some plummy, raisiny and candied orange peel fruitiness, within a fruity sweet candyish warmth mouthfeel of port-breadyish, Grand marnier liqueur, leading towards a malty, fruity, warming finish.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2008 In short: A peppery dark Belgian ale with dark fruits and nutty flavours.  Excellent.
How: Bottle 750ml, 2 months old
The look: Brown-ruby body with a long-lasting large beige head
In long: Peppery nose.  Rich creamy mouthfeel, grainy malts, somewhat yeasty, doughy.  Initially the beer presents notes of dark fruits (figs, dates and friends) but as it warms up (I drank an Orval halfway through) the fruity notes fade away making room for a nice creamy nutty flavour.  Grounded black pepper remains an upfront flavour but thats no problem to me as I am one of those who mourn the first batch of Dieu Du Ciel Route des Épices (the batch that was so peppery that they had to tame it down).  At a tasting session we had both the Lupulus and Hibernus at and I was initially more impressed by the Lupulus.  However after drinking a full bottle of each I found that the Lupulus starts amazing (4.4) but I got used to it while the Hibernus starts very good (3.8) but really grew on me.  I ended-up finding both equally excellent (4.2).  Both of these two pricy beers are as good as sex and unfortunately in my case just about as expensive.

2008-02-26. Bottle, 2007 Vintage. Brown bdoy with a nice foamy tan head. Sweet fruity aroma, solid malt foundation. Light spice reminds me a bit of a boerwoer sausage for some reason. Not the meat, but the spice. Brief note of orange citrus? Richly complex, sweet malty flavour, rich fruit tones. Very light spice (8+) Smooth medium palate. I havent adequately delved into its nuances but its pretty nice! Bottle shared by HogTownHarry

Bottle (750ml).  Shared with blankboy, biegaman, GregClow, mabel, mds and jerc - my bottle via trade with Viper666.  Cloudy red-brown, average beiege creamy head.  Spice/pungent aroma, somewhat herbal, caramel malt - really appealing.  Taste - wow, pungent spice (clove, nutmeg), fresh and powerful, hides the solid malt and alcohol well.  Excellent.  Decent body, astringency from the heady spice - would be truly great with some age-mellowing.

One other commenter mentioned root beer flavors and the whole time I was drinking this THATS the description I was trying for but not getting .  Lots of spice.  I seemed to notice some cinnamon undertones, but there was a lot going on in this beer.  It was hard to quantify everything you were tasting.  It was a nice drink, but there was almost to much there to appreciate everything.

Objectively speaking:
Complex, spicy Belgian strong inspired on their Double.


I like:
Balanced spices level except pepper. Roundness. Classy texture, authentic carbonation.


Id prefer:
Extra fruity depth. Further control on the pepper. Less higher alcohols.

Pours a dark brown color with a medium, creamy, tan head. Nice aroma of spices, licorice and plump fruits. Very good flavor of licorice, spices, fruits and strong sweetness. The body is medium with a liquorous texture and gentle carbonation.

Dark red, lightly cloudy poor with a thin frothy/creamy off-white head.  Aromas of sweet plums and bread, figs, black cherries, coriander, blackberries, lightly smoked, pepperettes, maple syrup, grapes and hints of fresh apples.  Almost no alcohol detection, medium bodied for a 10% brew.  Nicely carbonated and perfectly balanced... Very well rounded!  Added flavors of licorice, slightly salty and preaty much the same as the aromas.  Very evolutive and an overall amazing brew... WOW!

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2010 My Bottom Line:
Black pepper, licorice and nutmeg flourish atop the dates and cherries in this masterful Belgian Strong Ale. The estery yeast profile, the authentic mouthfeel and the productive union of maltiness and spices have rendered quite the superlative symphony.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A proud crest of foam decorates the misty blood red.
-Star anise spiciness also emerges from the precise spice interplay, which also seems to include cloves and coriander, amongst others.
-Fertile earthiness also rises from the malt/yeast/spice cohesion.
-The body is beautifully sculpted; with its frothy carbonation and perfect attenuation, it never feels cumbersome for a beer this gravity.
-The spices in the 2009 vintage are better levelled than the 2007s.
-The black pepper flavors drop with a year or so on it, and licorice comes out more. A fantastic beer every way you look at it. 

Bottles; 2007 and 2009 vintage.
